Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: We plan to establish a management equity plan to ensure our management team’s interests are aligned with our interests, to foster our management stability and ultimately to enable us to effectively plan and successfully implement our strategies. -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is a private company with limited liability (besloten vennootschap met beperkte aansprakelijkheid) incorporated under laws of the Netherlands, with corporate seat (statutaire zetel) in Amsterdam, the Netherlands, and was incorporated on 1 April 2021. The Issuer has an issued and outstanding share capital of $100 comprised of 1,000,000,000,000,000 shares with a par value of $0.0000000000001. All shares have been issued and are fully paid up. The Issuer holds directly 100% of the share capital of Bidco and is wholly owned by Titan Holdings I B.V. The Issuer is registered with the Dutch trade register under registration number 82416834. The Issuer’s current financial year ends on 31 December 2021. The registered office of the Issuer is located at Keizersgracht 555, 1017 DR Amsterdam.

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer is formed on behalf of funds managed by KPS Capital Partners, LP (“KPS”). KPS, through its affiliated management entities, is the manager of the KPS Special Situations Funds, a family of investment funds with over $12.8 billion of assets under management (as of March 31, 2021). For nearly three decades, the Partners of KPS have worked exclusively to realize significant capital appreciation by making controlling equity investments in manufacturing and industrial companies across a diverse array of industries, including basic materials, branded consumer healthcare and luxury products, automotive parts, capital equipment and general manufacturing. KPS creates value for its investors by working constructively with talented management teams to make businesses better, and generates investment returns by structurally improving the strategic position, competitiveness and profitability of its portfolio companies, rather than primarily relying on financial leverage. The KPS Funds' portfolio companies have aggregate annual revenues of approximately $10.6 billion, operate 156 manufacturing facilities in 23 countries, and have approximately 40,000 employees, directly and through joint ventures worldwide. KPS, as a leading global investment firm, has a significant and longstanding presence in Europe, with offices in Amsterdam and Frankfurt. KPS' portfolio companies have 35 manufacturing facilities with 11,000 employees in Europe. KPS has a strong trackrecord of realising improvements in manufacturing businesses and over two decades of constructive investing in highly complex corporate carve-outs on a global basis. KPS’ distinct and differentiated investment strategy has consistently resulted in the creation of world-class, industry-leading manufacturing companies. KPS has significant experience in the packaging industry having owned Anchor Glass Container, Blue Ridge Paper Products, Curtis Papers and Expera Specialty Solutions. Corporate carve-outs have represented over 50% of KPS’ platform investments and include carve-outs from leading global corporations such as AB InBev, Adidas, Ardagh Group, Baker Hughes, Bosch, Brunswick, Colfax, Cookson, Delphi, Dover, Dresser, Harris Teeter, Norsk Hydro, International Paper, Johnson Controls Olin Corporation, Packaging Dynamics, Schlumberger, Smurfit-Stone, Thyssen Krupp and Wausau Paper. Following the Completion Date, the Issuer’s indirect shareholders (excluding ownership of Titan Group by Senior Management) will be, subject to a customary post-closing adjustment to reflect, among others, changes in our net debt, cash and net working capital between execution of the Acquisition Agreement and the Completion Date: - an entity controlled by KPS, which will own 80% of the equity of an indirect parent of the Issuer; and - an entity controlled by Crown, which will indirectly own the remaining 20% of the equity of an indirect parent of the Issuer. Crown is a leading global packaging solutions provider with annual net sales of over $11.5 billion in 2020. -----

Section Title: BUSINESS
Subsubsection Text: _Unless the context indicates otherwise, in this section references to “we,” “us,” “our,” the “Titan Group” or the “Group,” refer, to the subsidiaries and assets comprising the Business. The statements in this section include, inter alia, projections and objectives in respect of our financial results and our estimated benefits from the Acquisition, as well as statements with respect to our strategic goals and objectives. Although we believe that the expectations reflected in such forward-looking statements are reasonable, we do not provide any assurance with respect to such statements. The preparation of statements included under this section is based upon, inter alia, certain assumptions concerning future events and management actions and such events and action may not actually be realized, as they depend substantially on variables which management cannot control, and may involve situations that management cannot predict. As a result, the projections and objectives in the statements included under this section are by definition uncertain and may differ materially from and be more negative than those projected or implied in the projections and objectives. You should not place undue reliance on the projections and objectives, which speak only as of the date that they were made. We do not undertake any obligation to update such forward-looking statements after the date hereof to reflect later events or circumstances or to reflect the occurrence of unanticipated events. See also “Forward-Looking Statements” and “Risk Factors.”_

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: At the Completion Date, an entity affiliated with KPS and Crown will enter into a shareholders’ agreement with respect to an indirect parent of the Issuer, which will set out the governance of the entity indirectly controlling the Issuer. The principal terms of such shareholders’ agreement have been agreed in the Acquisition Agreement. KPS will control Titan Group and will appoint the majority of the directors, with Crown to be granted customary protection for a minority shareholder (including a consent right over changes to the nature of the business conducted by Titan Group and certain related party transactions). The shareholders’ agreement will contain restrictions on the transfer of shares, tag-along, first refusal, pre-emptive and other rights commensurate with KPS’s majority and Crown’s minority shareholdings. Other than customary non-solicit, non-hire and confidentiality restrictions, the shareholders’ agreement will also contain a non-compete covenant by Crown pursuant to which Crown, subject to customary conditions, shall not compete with the Business as conducted by Titan Group as at the Completion Date.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: At the Completion Date, Bidco and Crown will enter into the Transitional Services Agreement, pursuant to which the Crown and its affiliates (the “Crown Group”) and Bidco and its affiliates (the “Titan Group”) will provide services to each other (the “Services”). The Services will generally relate to the following: - The Titan Group, will provide Crown with (i) master data and address book management and processing, (ii) support on manufacturing accounting and shared service centre activities (e.g. IT, data management, accounting), and (iii) legal, finance and human resources-related support services, including payroll support, based on Crown's needs in certain European jurisdictions. - The Crown Group will provide the Titan Group with (i) support in shared service centre activities (e.g. IT, data management, accounting) until the Business becomes autonomous, and (ii) legal, finance and human resourcesrelated support services, including payroll support, in the United Kingdom. Certain facilities leased by the Titan Group and the Crown Group will be cost-shared in connection with the provision of Services, with appropriate segregations in place between the Titan Group, on the one hand, and the Crown Group on the other hand. The parties to the Transitional Services Agreement will also use commercially reasonable efforts to procure that the terms and associated costs upon which the third party provides the Services are substantially equivalent to the terms and associated costs enjoyed by the supplier prior to commencement of the Transitional Services Agreement (as adjusted for ordinary inflation and/or current fluctuations in relation to third party inputs, to the extent applicable). Each party will retain all rights, title and interest in the intellectual property for the Service it provides, provided that data or other intellectual property will be the property of the party receiving such Service to the extent it is exclusively used in the receiving party’s business, and subject to certain exceptions, the parties will license to one another, on a non-exclusive basis, the intellectual property needed to satisfy their obligations under the Transitional Services Agreement. ----- The Services will be provided by the parties at a fixed price exclusive of reasonable and documented out of pocket expenses of the supplier party, which amounts (without mark-up) shall be borne by the recipient party. Proposed changes to the costs of the Services shall be subject to the recipient party’s written approval (which shall not be unreasonably withheld). The Transitional Services Agreement will terminate on the earlier of (i) the date on which all Services have expired, (ii) either the Transitional Services Agreement or all Services to be provided are terminated in accordance with the terms of the Transitional Services Agreement, or (iii) a certain number of months from the Completion Date (such number to be agreed between the parties prior to the Completion Date). The Transitional Services Agreement provides for the potential extension of any Service, the requested extension shall be considered by “Service Managers” nominated by both parties in good faith but the supplier party shall be under no obligation to accept any requested change to the Services. Any Service may be terminated by the party receiving such Service by providing a written notice of termination in a timely manner and subject to applicable law.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: As at the Completion Date, Macsco 20.11 Limited, a subsidiary of Titan, will enter into the Post-Completion Braunstone Agreement, pursuant to which Crown Packaging Manufacturing UK Limited will supply Macsco 20.11 Limited with tinplate food can products manufactured at the Braunstone manufacturing facility for a transitional period. This facility currently manufactures products which relate to both the purchased business (i.e. food cans) and the retained business (i.e. beverage cans). In order to allow Crown time to move the beverage elements of the Braunstone business to a new facility, Crown will retain ownership of that business for a transitional period following Completion. During this period the Post-Completion Braunstone Agreement will provide Macsco 20.11 Limited with the product it requires from the Braunstone facility. The Braunstone transaction will complete (and the Post-Completion Braunstone Agreement will terminate) once Crown has moved the beverage business into a new facility, subject to a longstop date of three years.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: Crown Packaging Manufacturing UK Limited and Macsco 20.11 Limited entered into the Asset Purchase Agreement on April 8, 2021 pursuant to which Macsco 20.11 Limited has agreed to purchase the tinplate steel packaging business conducted by Crown Packaging Manufacturing UK Limited at the Braunstone manufacturing facility. The transfer of the Braunstone Business will complete on the termination of the Post-Completion Braunstone Agreement (as set out above).

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: As at the Completion Date, Titan will enter into the Post-Completion Wantage Agreement, pursuant to which Crown Packaging Manufacturing UK Limited will lease certain offices, laboratories and development/pilot areas at Crown's technical centre in Wantage, UK to Titan for a term of up to five years commencing on or around completion of the Transaction, with no contractual or statutory rights of renewal. The premises (and the rent) will be agreed between the parties, acting reasonably (or otherwise determined by an expert) before the Completion Date. As at the Completion Date, Titan will enter into the Engineering and Testing Services Agreement, pursuant to which access to engineering and testing services (including certain laboratories, equipment, and personnel) at Crown's technical centre at Wantage, UK, will be provided by Crown to the Business for a term of up to five years commencing on or around completion of the Transaction. The terms of this agreement are to be agreed between the parties prior to the Completion Date.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: At the Completion Date, the Crown Group and the Titan Group will enter into an IP Assignment Agreement. The IP Assignment Agreement contains certain provisions relating to the recordation of the transfers of intellectual property rights included in the Business (as defined herein) as further set forth in the Acquisition Agreement.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: At the Completion Date, the Crown Group and the Titan Group will enter into an IP Licence Agreement. Under the IP Licence Agreement, the Crown Group will grant the Titan Group: ----- (i) an exclusive license under specified patents to sell products and practice related methods and processes in connection with the Business in Europe, Africa and the Middle East; (ii) a non-exclusive license to use specified patents to export products in the Business worldwide, provided that the Titan Group may only do so in the U.S., Mexico, Canada, Singapore, China, Vietnam and Thailand to the same extent as was done prior to the Completion Date; and (iii) a non-exclusive license to use specified know-how and copyrights in connection with the sale of products in the Business worldwide. The licenses will be granted for the life of the specified patents and on a perpetual basis for all other intellectual property. The licenses are also irrevocable, royalty-free and fully paid-up. The Titan Group may assign the IP Licence Agreement without the consent of the Crown Group: (i) in connection with a corporate reorganization, (ii) to a successor to all or substantially all of the business or assets to which the agreement relates or (iii) in connection with a sale, spin-off or divestiture of any portion of the Business.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: At the Completion Date, the Titan Group and the Crown Group will enter into a Grantback License Agreement. Under the Grantback License Agreement, the Titan Group will grant to the Crown Group: (i) a license to specified patents to sell products and practice methods, procedures, or processes in connection with the foregoing outside Europe, Africa and the Middle East in any field; (ii) a license under the specified patents to sell products in connection with the Crown Group’s business in the Asian Pacific region of the world: (a) outside of the Business in Europe, Africa and the Middle East and (b) inside the Business in Europe, Africa and the Middle East solely to the extent such products were sold by the Crown Group’s Asia Pacific business prior to the Completion Date; (iii) a license to conduct research and development activities in Europe, Africa and the Middle East in any field; and (iv) a license to sell tinplate steel beverage crowns and practice related methods, procedures or processes in the Business in Europe, Africa and the Middle East. The licenses will be granted for the life of the specified patents and on a perpetual basis for all other intellectual property. The licenses are also irrevocable, royalty-free and fully paid-up. The Titan Group may freely assign the Grantback License Agreement without the consent of the Crown Group. The Crown Group may assign the Grantback License Agreement without the consent of the Titan Group: (i) in connection with a corporate reorganization, (ii) to a successor to all or substantially all of the business or assets to which the agreement relates or (iii) in connection with a sale, spin-off or divestiture of any portion of the Crown Group’s retained business.

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: It is expected that the Issuer, or an affiliate thereof, will enter into a management services agreement with KPS, or an affiliate thereof, in which the Issuer, or an affiliate thereof, agrees to pay to KPS, or an affiliate thereof, (i) a transaction fee in exchange for the services rendered by it in connection with the Transactions and (ii) certain fees and disbursements in exchange for KPS, or an affiliate thereof, providing ongoing monitoring, management, consulting and financial services to Titan Group. -----

Section Title: RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
Subsubsection Text: _The Issuer is a holding company formed for the purpose of facilitating the Acquisition and is not expected to engage in any activities other than those related to the Acquisition. The Issuer’s only material assets and liabilities are currently, and are expected in the future to be up until the Acquisition, its interest in the issued and outstanding shares of its subsidiaries and its outstanding indebtedness and intercompany balances incurred in connection with the Acquisition and the other transactions described in the Offering Memorandum. We do not present in this Offering Memorandum any financial information or financial statements of the Issuer, except for certain limited “as adjusted” financial information presented on a consolidated basis to reflect certain effects of the Acquisition and the Refinancing. The following is a description of material transactions currently in force to which we or our subsidiaries have been a party. Management believes that all such transactions have been effected at arm’s length and upon market terms and rates, i.e., in line with conditions that would have applied between non-related parties. You should also see the attached combined financial statements and the related notes thereto appearing elsewhere in this Offering Memorandum for a discussion of certain intra-group transactions._

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: In connection with the Financing of the Acquisition, Bidco will, on or prior to the Completion Date, enter into the Credit Facilities Agreement with, among others, Barclays Bank PLC as agent (the “Senior Agent”) and Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch as security agent (the “Security Agent”), and Barclays Bank PLC, Barclays Bank Ireland PLC, BNP Paribas, Credit Suisse AG, London Branch, Credit Suisse (Deutschland) Aktiengesellschaft, Deutsche Bank Aktiengesellschaft, UBS AG London Branch, Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank, Sucursal en España, UniCredit Bank AG, MUFG Bank (Europe) N.V. and Coӧperatieve Rabobank U.A. as mandated lead arrangers (the “Mandated Lead Arrangers”). The Credit Facilities Agreement will provide for committed facilities in the following amounts: - a €1,175.0 million senior secured term loan B facility (the “Term Loan B Facility”); and - a €275.0 million senior secured multi-currency revolving credit facility (the “Revolving Credit Facility” and, together with Term Loan B Facility, the “Senior Facilities”). Term Loan B Facility may be utilized by Bidco and may be used (directly or indirectly) (i) to finance or refinance amounts payable in connection with the Acquisition, (ii) to finance or refinance the payment of any fees, costs, taxes and expenses related to or incurred or charged in connection with the Acquisition, (iii) to refinance any existing indebtedness of the Target Group, together with any associated fees, costs, taxes and expenses and/or (iv) for any other purpose contemplated by the tax structure memorandum or the funds flow statement prepared by Bidco. The Revolving Credit Facility may be utilized by Bidco and certain members of the TLB Group (for the purposes of the Credit Facilities Agreement, the “TLB Group” consists of Bidco and its subsidiaries from time to time, but excluding Unrestricted Subsidiaries (under and as defined in the Credit Facilities Agreement)) who accede as additional borrowers in euros, sterling, U.S. dollars and certain other currencies readily available in the relevant interbank market by the drawing of cash advances, the issue of bank guarantees, standby letters of credit and ancillary and fronted ancillary facilities. The Revolving Credit Facility may be used (directly or indirectly) for the TLB Group’s working capital and general corporate purposes, including, without limitation, the refinancing and repayment of existing revolving credit or other workin§ g capital debt and the funding of (i) capital expenditures, (ii) acquisitions and investments (other than the Acquisition), (iii) operational restructurings and reorganisations of the TLB Group, (iv) payments (including made to vendors) in respect of working capital relating to or arising in connection with any acquisition (including the Acquisition), (v) payment of transaction costs, tax, OID, fees (including any ticking fees), flex and other financing costs, including VAT thereon and/or (vi) any other purpose contemplated by the tax structure memorandum and the funds flow statement prepared by Bidco. In addition to Term Loan B Facility and the Revolving Credit Facility, the Credit Facilities Agreement includes the ability to incur additional indebtedness (including under one or more additional facilities documented within or outside of the Credit Facilities Agreement and/or additional Notes and/or other notes) up to an aggregate principal amount equal to the greater of €270 million and 100% of consolidated pro forma EBITDA (as defined in the Credit Facilities Agreement), plus the aggregate amount of all prepayments of the Senior Facilities and any Senior Secured Indebtedness, debt buy backs, any repayment following the exercise of “yank the bank” and any other commitment reductions in respect of the Senior Facilities, plus an unlimited amount, provided that, pro forma for the incurrence of such indebtedness: (i) if such indebtedness constitutes senior secured liabilities under the Intercreditor Agreement, the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio would not exceed 4.75:1 or, if incurred in connection with a permitted acquisition or other permitted investment, the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio in effect immediately prior thereto; or (ii) if such indebtedness does not constitute senior secured liabilities under the Intercreditor Agreement, the Group’s fixed charge cover ratio would be at least 2.00:1 or the Group’s total net leverage ratio would not exceed 6.25x or, in either case, if incurred in connection with a permitted acquisition or other permitted investment, the Group’s fixed charge cover ratio or total net leverage ratio, as applicable, in effect immediately prior thereto, in each case, subject to certain other conditions being met. The Credit Facilities Agreement will also require that certain creditors in respect of secured and unsecured indebtedness permitted to be incurred under the Credit Facilities Agreement, including pursuant to certain ratio tests and baskets, will be required to accede to the Intercreditor Agreement to the extent such indebtedness exceeds certain agreed thresholds. ----- _Availability_ The Term Loan B Facility will be available on and from the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement up to the earlier of: (a) 6 December 2021 or, if earlier, the date which is ten (10) Business Days after the date that is the Longstop Date (as defined in the Acquisition Agreement, as such date may be extended from time to time with the consent of all the Mandated Lead Arrangers) or such later date as may be agreed by the Senior Agent (acting on the instructions of all the lenders under the Credit Facilities Agreement), (b) the date on which Bidco (or KPS) notifies the Mandated Lead Arrangers in writing that the Acquisition Agreement is terminated by either party thereto in accordance with its terms and (c) the Completion Date. The Revolving Credit Facility may be utilized from the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement until the date which is one month prior to the maturity date applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility. _Interest and Fees_ Loans under the Credit Facilities Agreement will bear interest at a variable rate per annum. For loans denominated in dollars, the rate will be based on the London Interbank Offer Rate (“LIBOR”) until switching on 31 December 2021 to the Secured Overnight Financing Rate (“SOFR”) administered by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. For loans denominated in Sterling or euro, the rate will be based on the Sterling Over Night Index Average Rate (“SONIA”) or the Euro Interbank Offered Rate (“EURIBOR”) respectively. In each case, an applicable margin will be added to the interest rate, which (following the first full fiscal quarter commencing after the Completion Date) will be subject to a decreasing margin ratchet based on the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio. In addition, the margin applicable to Loans under the Term Loan B Facility will be subject to a sustainability margin ratchet based on certain key performance indicators in respect of the TLB Group’s results of operation which is expected to commence in 2022 on or or around the date of the delivery to the Senior Agent of the Non-Financial Annual Report, as further described in the definitive documentation for the Term Loan B Facility. If LIBOR, SOFR, SONIA or EURIBOR is less than zero, LIBOR, SOFR, SONIA or EURIBOR (as the case may be) shall be deemed to be zero in respect of Term Loan B Facility loans and Revolving Credit Facility loans. A commitment fee will be payable on the aggregate undrawn and uncancelled amount of the Revolving Credit Facility from the date of first utilization of the Senior Facilities to the end of the availability period applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility at a rate of 30% of the applicable margin for the Revolving Credit Facility. Commitment fees will be payable quarterly in arrear, on the last date of the availability period applicable to the Revolving Credit Facility and, if cancelled in full, on the cancelled amount of the relevant lender’s commitment at the time the cancellation becomes effective. Default interest will be calculated as an additional 1% on the defaulted amount. _Repayments_ Term Loan B Facility will be repaid in full on the date that is seven years from the Completion Date. In respect of the Revolving Credit Facility, each advance will be repaid on the last day of the interest period relating thereto, subject to an ability to roll over cash drawings. All outstanding amounts under the Revolving Credit Facility will be repaid on the date falling six and a half years from the Completion Date. Amounts repaid by the borrowers on loans made under the Revolving Credit Facility may be reborrowed, subject to certain conditions being met. The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain a “soft call” whereby lenders under Term Loan B Facility will, subject to customary carve-outs and exceptions, benefit from a prepayment fee of 1% if Term Loan B Facility is voluntarily refinanced or amended pursuant to a refinancing transaction (other than in connection with any transaction that would constitute a change of control, initial public offering or other transformative acquisition) within 6 months of first utilization of the Senior Facilities, the primary purpose of which is reduce the yield on Term Loan B Facility. _Voluntary and Mandatory Prepayments_ The Credit Facilities Agreement will permit voluntary prepayments to be made (subject to certain restrictions on the number of voluntary prepayments permitted to be made and de minimis amounts) and will require mandatory prepayment in full or in part in certain circumstances, including: - on a change of control or an initial public offering which results in a change of control, subject to an individual lender put option at par; - from certain excess proceeds received by Bidco or any guarantor under the Term Loan B Facility from certain asset disposals, to the extent required to be applied in prepayment of the Senior Facilities and subject to (i) step-downs based on the Group’s total net leverage ratio and (ii) certain de minimis amounts; and ----- - for each financial year (commencing with the first full financial year commencing after the Completion Date), a percentage of excess cash flow, subject to (i) step-downs based on the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio and (ii) certain de minimis amounts. _Guarantees and Security_ Subject to certain agreed security principles and the terms of the Credit Facilities Agreement, the Senior Facilities will benefit from guarantees and security from certain members of the TLB Group incorporated in The Netherlands, England & Wales, France, Germany, Italy and Spain which will be limited by reference to certain legal and tax issues. _Representations and Warranties_ The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain certain representations and warranties (subject to certain agreed qualifications and with certain representations being repeated), including: - status, binding obligations, non-conflict with other obligations, power and authority, validity and admissibility in evidence, governing law and enforcement, consents, fillings and laws applicable to operations and pari passu ranking; - no insolvency, no litigation, environmental laws, taxation liabilities and filing and stamp taxes; - no default, financial statements, non-financial annual reports, group structure, the information memorandum, base case model and reports; - no security, guarantees or financial indebtedness, except as permitted; - intellectual property, legal and beneficial ownership in relation to material assets and shares fully paid; - acquisition documents containing all material terms; - limitations on holding company activities; and - centre of main interests and compliance with sanctions and anti-corruption laws. Certain representations and warranties will be made on the date of the Credit Facilities Agreement and first utilization of the Senior Facilities and repeated on the date of each utilization, on the first day of each interest period and at certain other times. _Covenants_ The Credit Facilities Agreement will contain certain incurrence covenants, information undertakings and related definitions consistent with the those applicable to the Notes (with, in each case, certain adjustments), including (i) limitations on indebtedness and issuance of disqualified stock and preferred stock; (ii) limitations on restricted payments; (iii) limitations on liens; (iv) limitations on sale of assets and subsidiary stock; (v) limitations on affiliate transactions; (vi) designation of restricted and Unrestricted Subsidiaries; (vii) restrictions on merger and consolidation of Bidco and guarantors; (viii) additional intercreditor agreements; (ix) limitation on restrictions on the payment of dividends or certain other classes of intra-Group transactions; (x) restriction on impairment of security interests; and (xi) a restriction on the activities of the Issuer. In addition, the Credit Facilities Agreement will also require Bidco and certain of its restricted subsidiaries to observe certain other customary positive and negative covenants, subject to customary and other exceptions and qualifications, including covenants relating to (i) the provision of financial statements and certain other information; (ii) authorizations and consents; (iii) maintenance of status and authorization; (iv) pari passu ranking; (v) insurances; (vi) taxes; (vii) access to certain financial information (where certain events of default are continuing); (viii) enforcement of rights under the Acquisition agreement; (ix) intellectual property; (x) environmental laws; (xi) acquisition documents; (xii) provision of guarantees and security and further assurance; (xiii) centre of main interests; (xiv) reasonable endeavors to maintain a rating (but not a specific rating) and (xv) compliance with sanctions and anti-corruption laws. Solely for the benefit of the lenders participating in the Revolving Credit Facility, the Credit Facilities Agreement will require that, in the event that the aggregate amount of all utilizations under the Revolving Credit Facility (excluding any utilizations by way of letters of credit, bank guarantees or ancillary facilities or any amounts utilized to fund any original issue discount or up-front fees incurred in connection with the syndication of the Senior Facilities) exceeds an agreed percentage of the total commitments under the Revolving Credit Facility on the relevant testing date, the Group’s consolidated senior secured net leverage ratio does not exceed an agreed ratio. The financial covenant will be subject to an equity cure regime. ----- It is intended that certain agreed covenants and other provisions of the Credit Facilities Agreement will fall away on the satisfaction of certain release conditions, being (i) the occurrence of a listing in respect of which the Group’s consolidated total net leverage ratio is equal to or less than an agreed ratio or (ii) any member of the TLB Group or any parent holding company having a long-term corporate credit rating equal to or better than Baa3 according to Moody’s or BBB- according to S&P’s. _Events of Default_ The Credit Facilities Agreement will provide for substantially consistent events of default as under the Notes, the occurrence of which would allow, unless otherwise indicated below, the majority (being 50.1%) of the lenders under the Credit Facilities Agreement to accelerate all outstanding loans and terminate their commitments (subject in certain cases to agreed grace periods, financial thresholds, cure rights, clean-up periods and other qualifications) including (i) breach of the financial covenant, provided that (A) in the event of such breach, only the majority lenders under the Revolving Credit Facility may exercise acceleration rights as a result of such breach and (B) if the majority lenders under the Revolving Credit Facility have exercised such acceleration rights as a result of such breach, the remaining lenders shall have a right of cross-acceleration; (ii) misrepresentation; (iii) invalidity and unlawfulness of the Credit Facilities financing documents; (iv) repudiation and recession of the Credit Facilities financing documents; (v) breach of material obligations under the Credit Facilities financing documents; and (vi) material failure to comply with the Intercreditor Agreement.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: To establish the relative rights of certain of the Group’s creditors under our financing arrangements, Bidco, each of the Guarantors (together with any other entity which accedes to the Intercreditor Agreement as a debtor, (the “Debtors”)) and the Issuer will enter into the Intercreditor Agreement with, among others, the Security Agent and the Senior Agent. On or about the Issue Date, the Trustee in respect of the Notes will become party to the Intercreditor Agreement. The Intercreditor Agreement is governed by English law and sets out, among other things, the relative ranking of certain debt of the Debtors, when payments can be made in respect of debt of the Debtors, when enforcement action can be taken in respect of that debt, the terms pursuant to which certain of that debt will be subordinated upon the occurrence of certain insolvency events and turnover provisions. By accepting a Note, the relevant holder thereof shall be deemed to have agreed to, and accepted the terms and conditions of, the Intercreditor Agreement. The following description is a summary of certain provisions contained in the Intercreditor Agreement which relate to the rights and obligations of the holders of the Notes. It does not restate the Intercreditor Agreement in its entirety. As such, you are urged to read the Intercreditor Agreement because it, and not the discussion that follows, defines certain rights of the holders of the Notes. Capitalized terms used but not defined in the Certain Definitions section herein have the meanings given to them in the Intercreditor Agreement.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS

Subsubsection Text: Notes, amounts due to the Senior Agent under the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, amounts due to any facility agent under a Second Lien Facility, amounts due to any facility agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility, and amounts due to the trustee of the Senior Subordinated Notes (the “Senior Secured Notes Trustee”) pari passu and without any preference between them; - second, the liabilities owed under any guarantee granted by a guarantor of Senior Subordinated Notes to any holder of Senior Subordinated Notes (a “Senior Subordinated Noteholder”) and the trustee in respect of Senior Subordinated Notes (the “Senior Subordinated Notes **Trustee”), the Security Agent in respect of Senior Subordinated Notes, or by a guarantor of a Senior Subordinated Facility to the lenders under that Senior Subordinated Facility (a “Senior Subordinated Facility Lender”) and other finance parties in respect of a Senior Subordinated Facility (the creditors described in this bullet together the “Senior Subordinated **Creditors” and such liabilities the “Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities”) other than the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee Amounts pari passu between themselves and without any preference between them. The Liabilities owed by any Second Lien Issuer/Borrower (to the extent relating to Liabilities in respect of Second Lien Notes and/or any agreement documenting a Second Lien Facility (a “Second Lien Facility Agreement”) where that Second Lien Issuer/Borrower is the issuer or, as the case may be, the borrower of such Liabilities) to the Secured Creditors shall rank pari _passu in right and priority of payment without any preference amongst them._ The Notes (as defined in the section titled ‘Certain Definitions’) and any additional notes issued from time to time in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement shall qualify as Senior Subordinated Notes for purposes of the Intercreditor Agreement and the Guarantees of the Senior Subordinated Notes shall qualify as Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities. On the Issue Date of the Senior Subordinated Notes, no Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, Second Lien Lender Liabilities or Second Lien Notes Liabilities will be outstanding. Such Liabilities may only be incurred if not prohibited under the terms of the relevant finance documents in respect of the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, Senior Secured Notes, Second Lien Facilities, Second Lien Notes, Senior Subordinated Facilities, Senior Subordinated Notes, the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement, the Bilateral Facility Documents, Other Secured Finance Documents, the security documents, any agreement evidencing the Investor Liabilities or the intra-group liabilities or the Intercreditor Agreement, including, without limitation, the covenants applicable to the Notes (together the “Debt Documents”).

Subsection Title: Liabilities” shall also encompass such liabilities which have become Affected Liabilities from time to time.
Subsubsection Text: For these purposes: “Affected Liabilities” means in respect of any relevant liabilities, (a) those liabilities which have been extinguished or discharged in connection with a Foreclosure (as defined below) (other than by payment in cash), (b) those liabilities which have been released, waived or reduced (including under an abandon de créance or remise de dette) at any time following the Foreclosure Date (as defined below), (c) those liabilities which have been converted into Investment Instruments at any time following a Foreclosure, (d) the amount of the Soulte (as defined below) (if any) effectively paid by the Creditors (as defined below) of those liabilities (or any representative thereof) in connection with a Foreclosure but only to the extent (i) not funded (at the time of such payment) out of Cash Proceeds (as defined below) allocated in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement or (ii) not repaid by the relevant payee pursuant to a clawback. “Cash Proceeds” means (a) all amounts or distributions received in cash by the Foreclosed Assets Holders (as defined below) in respect of certain Collateral (or assets of companies the shares of which constitute Collateral) foreclosed on by the Secured Parties (as defined below) (“Foreclosed Assets”) or Investment Instruments issued by a Secured Parties SPV (as defined below) (including dividends, interest, repayment of principal or share capital and amounts received in connection with a liquidation or a winding-up of the issuer of the Foreclosed Assets or in connection with a liquidation or a winding-up of a Secured Parties SPV) and (b) all proceeds received in cash by Foreclosed Assets Holders as a result of an Exit Disposal (as defined below), in each case before deducting any liabilities for taxes incurred and required to be paid by Foreclosed Assets Holders in connection with those distributions but, in the case of either a sale of Foreclosed Assets by a Secured Parties SPV or a sale of shares in any ----- entity which is a subsidiary of any Debtor whose Investment Instruments are the object of a Foreclosure or the Secured Parties SPV, after deducting any taxes payable by the seller. “Soulte” means, in relation to any Foreclosure, the amount by which the value of the Collateral so appropriated or foreclosed as a result of such Foreclosure (as determined in accordance with the relevant Transaction Security Document) exceeds the amount of the secured obligations secured under the corresponding Transaction Security Document immediately prior to the occurrence of such Foreclosure occurring (which, for the avoidance of doubt, shall not include any Assigned Recourse Rights (as defined below) arising from or in connection with such Foreclosure). _Priority of Security_ For the purposes of this description only: “ICA Group” refers to Bidco and each of its Restricted Subsidiaries from time to time including on and from the Completion Date, the Target Group, provided that, notwithstanding anything to the contrary, no Unrestricted Subsidiary (as defined in the Credit Facilities Agreement) or any of its Subsidiaries for the time being shall be a member of the ICA Group (or a subsidiary, holding company or affiliate of any member of the ICA Group or a joint venture) for the purposes of the Debt Documents. “Senior Subordinated Group” refers to the Issuer and/or any of its holding companies or affiliates (“Senior Subordinated

being shall be a member of the Senior Subordinated Group (or a subsidiary, holding company or affiliate of any member of the Senior Subordinated Group or a joint venture) for the purposes of the Debt Documents. “Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral” refers to the share security granted by Topco over its shares in the Issuer, security granted by Topco over any receivables owed to Topco by any member of the Group in respect of any shareholder loan and security granted by the Issuer over its material bank accounts and any other document designated as such by Topco and the Independent Security Agent so long as such security is not granted by a member of the ICA Group or over shares or equivalent ownership interests in any member of the ICA Group, in each case which is created, or expressed to be created, in favor of the Independent Security Agent as agent or trustee for the other Senior Subordinated Secured Parties (or if such security agency or trustee arrangements are not legally possible, in favor of all the Senior Subordinated Secured Parties or in favor of the Independent Security Agent under a parallel debt or similar structure). “Common Collateral” refers to security which is created, or expressed to be created, in favor of the Common Security Agent as agent or trustee for the other Secured Parties in respect of the liabilities owed to them by a member of the Senior Subordinated Group, in the case of the Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities or the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities, or otherwise, by a member of the ICA Group, in each case under the Debt Documents (or if such security agency or trustee arrangements are not legally possible, in favor of all the Secured Parties or in favor of the Common Security Agent under a parallel debt or similar structure), so long as such collateral is not Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral. The Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral shall rank and secure the following liabilities in the following order: - first, the liabilities owed to the security agent in respect of the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral, (the “Independent Security Agent”) amounts due to any facility agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility and amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee pari passu and without any preference between them; and - second, the liabilities owed to any creditor under a Senior Subordinated Facility (the “Senior Subordinated

Subsubsection Text: ----- “Senior Subordinated Agent Liabilities”) and amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee (the “Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee Amounts”), pari passu and without any preference between them; - second, the Senior Lender Liabilities, the Bilateral Facility Liabilities, the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities and the Hedging Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them; and - third, the Second Lien Lender Liabilities and the Second Lien Notes Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them; and - fourth, the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities pari passu and without any preference between them. _Second Lien Liabilities and security_ The Second Lien Liabilities owed (if any) by a Second Lien Issuer/Borrower (to the extent relating to Liabilities in respect of Second Lien Notes and/or any Second Lien Facility Agreement where that Second Lien Issuer/Borrower is the issuer or, as the case may be, the borrower of such Liabilities) are senior obligations of that Second Lien Issuer/Borrower. The Second Lien Liabilities are entitled to benefit from certain security including the Common Collateral and certain types of Security that the finance documents in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities (the “Senior Secured Finance Documents”) contemplate may be granted to the Second Lien Creditors without also being offered to the Senior Secured Creditors (defined below). Notwithstanding the above paragraph, until the Senior Discharge Date (defined below), the Second Lien Creditors may not take any steps to appropriate the assets of a Second Lien Issuer/Borrower subject to the Security Documents in connection with any Enforcement Action, other than as expressly permitted by the Intercreditor Agreement. “Second Lien Issuer/Borrower” means the member of the ICA Group which is the issuer of any Second Lien Notes, or, as the case may be, borrower under any Second Lien Facility Agreement which complies with certain other restrictions set out in the Intercreditor Agreement as to being an entity which: (a) is not liable in respect of certain Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities (defined below); or (b) meets certain criteria as to being a special purpose financing vehicle. _Intra-Group Liabilities, Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities, Investor Liabilities and Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities_ The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that: - the intra-group liabilities of the Debtors to another member of the ICA Group are postponed and subordinated to the liabilities owed by the Debtors or any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower to the Secured Creditors; and - the liabilities owed to Topco or any holding company of Topco under any agreement providing a loan (other than the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan) from Topco or any holding company of Topco to the Issuer or a subsidiary of the Issuer or for any amounts to be paid by a member of the Senior Subordinated Group to Topco or any holding company of Topco (the “Investor Liabilities”), and the liabilities under any Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan made from a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower to Bidco for the purposes of on-lending the proceeds of the Senior Subordinated Notes or a loan under a Senior Subordinated Facility (a “Senior Subordinated Proceeds

Subsection Title: Loan” and the “Senior Subordinated** **Proceeds Loan Liabilities”) are postponed and subordinated to the
Subsubsection Title: Restrictions Relating to Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities
Subsubsection Text: The Issuer and the Debtors may make payment on the Senior Lender Liabilities, the Bilateral Facility Liabilities and the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities (together, the “Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities”) at any time, provided that following a Senior Distress Event which is continuing, payments may only be made by Debtors and received by creditors which is continuing in accordance with the provisions described under the caption “—Application of Proceeds.” The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Senior Secured Creditors, the Issuer, the Third Party Security Providers and the Debtors may at any time amend or waive any of the terms of the Senior Secured Finance Documents in accordance with their respective terms from time to time (and subject only to any consent required under them). ----- _Security and Guarantees: Senior Secured Creditors_ The Senior Lenders, the holders of any Senior Secured Notes (and/or any person acting on behalf of them), the Bilateral Lender and the Hedge Counterparties (the “Senior Secured Creditors”) may take, accept or receive the benefit of: - any security from any member of the ICA Group in respect of any of the Senior Secured Creditor Liabilities, in addition to the Common Collateral provided that (with certain exceptions for security granted to ancillary lenders, issuing banks and bilateral facility lenders) and to the extent legally possible and subject to certain agreed security principles, at the same time, it is also offered either: - to the Common Security Agent for the Secured Parties (as defined below) other than the Senior Subordinated Creditors (the “Priority Secured Parties”) in respect of their liabilities; or - in the case of any jurisdiction in which effective security cannot be granted in favor of the Common Security Agent or trustee for the Priority Secured Parties: - to the other Priority Secured Parties in respect of their liabilities; or - to the Common Security Agent under a parallel debt structure, or attorney-in-fact structure for the benefit of the other Priority Secured Parties, and ranks in the same order of priority as set out under the caption “—Priority of Security,” provided that all amounts actually received or recovered by any Senior Secured Creditors with respect to any such security shall immediately be paid to the Common Security Agent and held and applied in accordance with the provisions set out under the caption “—Application of Proceeds”; - any guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss from any member of the ICA Group regarding the Senior Lender Liabilities or the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities or the Bilateral Facility Liabilities (the “Senior Secured

or - any actual or proposed defeasance, redemption, prepayment, repayment, purchase or other discharge of any Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities and/or liabilities under any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreement (in each case provided that such defeasance, redemption, prepayment, repayment, purchase or other discharge is not prohibited by the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement).

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Date”), the Majority Senior Secured Creditors;
Subsubsection Title: Restrictions Relating to Second Lien Liabilities
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement contains provisions governing permitted payments of Second Lien Liabilities and the various circumstances in which Second Lien Creditors (defined below) may take enforcement action prior to the Senior Secured Discharge Date. On the Completion Date, no Second Lien Liabilities will have been incurred by the ICA Group. Prior to the Senior Secured Discharge Date, the members of the ICA Group may only make payments in respect of the Second Lien Liabilities, in accordance with the finance documents governing such Second Lien Liabilities, subject to compliance with certain conditions in the Intercreditor Agreement which are broadly similar to those applying the Senior Subordinated Notes. The principal conditions are that the relevant payment is not prohibited by the Credit Facilities Agreement (or any other facility agreement evidencing Senior Lender Liabilities) or any Senior Secured Notes Indenture (or if it is so prohibited, the required consent has been obtained), no payment stop notice has been issued to the Second Lien Agent or the trustee in respect of any Second Lien Notes (the “Second Lien Notes Trustee”), and no Senior Secured Payment Default (defined below) is continuing. -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Date”), the Majority Senior Secured Creditors;
Subsubsection Title: Restrictions Relating to Senior Subordinated Notes
Subsubsection Text: _Restriction on Payment and Dealings_ The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that, until the Priority Discharge Date, the Debtors shall not (and shall ensure that no member of the ICA Group will): (i) pay, repay, prepay, redeem, acquire or defease any principal, interest or other amount on or in respect of, or make any distribution in respect of, any Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities (together, “Senior SubordinatedGroup Liabilities”) in cash or in kind or apply any such money or property in or towards discharge of any such liabilities except as permitted by the provisions set out below under the captions “— Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments,” “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Enforcement,” and the ninth paragraph under the caption “—Effect of Insolvency Event; Filing of Claims”; (ii) exercise any set-off against any Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities, except as permitted by the provisions set out in the caption “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments” below, the provisions set out in the caption “—Restrictions on Senior Subordinated Enforcement” below or the ninth paragraph under the caption “—Effect of Insolvency Event; Filing of Claims” below; (iii) create or permit to subsist any security guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss from (or over any assets of or shares in) any member of the ICA Group or give any guarantee (and the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee and the agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility may not, and no creditor in respect of Senior Subordinated Notes or a Senior Subordinated Facility (together the “Senior Subordinated Creditors”) may accept, the benefit of any such security or guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss) from any member of the ICA Group for, or in respect of, any Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities (together, “Senior Subordinated Liabilities”) or Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities other than certain security including (i) in connection with any escrow or similar or equivalent arrangements entered into in respect of amounts which are being held (or will be held) by a person which is not a member of the ICA Group prior to release of those amounts or (ii) the Parent Common Transaction Security; or (iii) certain forms of security that the Senior Secured Finance Documents contemplate may be granted to the Senior Subordinated Creditors without being offered to the Senior Secured Creditors; or (iv) create or permit to subsist any Security, guarantee indemnity or other assurance against loss from (or over any assets of or shares in) any member of the Group or give any guarantee, and no Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower may take, accept or receive the benefit of any Security, guarantee, indemnity or other assistance against loss from any member of the Group for, or in respect of, the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities, unless that Security, guarantee, indemnity or other assurance against loss is not prohibited by the Prior Ranking Finance Agreements or, to the extent prohibited, the Required Consent has been obtained. _Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments_ Prior to the Priority Discharge Date, any member of the ICA Group may make payments to the Senior Subordinated Creditors (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities) or the Issuer (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only) then due in accordance with the finance documents in respect of the Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes (the “Senior Subordinated Finance Documents”) or the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (such payments, collectively, “Permitted Senior SubordinatedPayments”): (i) if: (A) the payment is not prohibited by any prior ranking financing agreements (in respect of the Senior Secured Liabilities and the Second Lien Liabilities), or any required consents to permit such payment has been obtained; (B) no Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice (defined below) is outstanding; and (C) no payment default under the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, Bilateral Facility or the Senior Secured Notes (a “Senior Secured Payment Default”), or under the Second Lien Facilities or Second Lien Notes (a “Second Lien

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Date”), the Majority Senior Secured Creditors;
Subsubsection Text: - on or after the Senior Secured Discharge Date but before the first date on which all Second Lien Liabilities have been discharged (the “Second Lien Discharge Date”), the Majority Second Lien Creditors; and - on or after the later to occur of the Senior Secured Discharge Date and the Second Lien Discharge Date (the “Priority Discharge Date”) but before the first date the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities and the Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities have been discharged (the “Senior Subordinated Discharge Date”), the Majority Senior Subordinated Creditors. “Majority Second Lien Creditors” means, at any time when (i) there are no Second Lien Notes Liabilities outstanding, Second Lien Creditors whose Second Lien Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3% of the total Second Lien Credit Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Second Lien Notes Liabilities outstanding, Second Lien Lenders and Second Lien Noteholders whose Second Lien Credit Participations aggregate more than 50% of the total Second Lien Credit Participations at that time. “Majority Senior Secured Creditors” means, at any time, when (i) there are no Senior Secured Notes Liabilities outstanding, Senior Lenders and certain hedge counterparties whose Senior Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3% of the total Senior Credit Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Senior Secured Notes Liabilities outstanding, Senior Lenders, Senior Secured Noteholders and certain hedge counterparties whose Senior Credit Participations aggregate more than 50% of the total Senior Credit Participations at that time. “Majority Senior Subordinated Creditors” means, at any time when (i) there are no Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities outstanding, those Senior Subordinated Creditors whose Senior Subordinated Credit Participations aggregate more than 66[2]⁄3% of the total Senior Subordinated Credit Participations at that time; and (ii) there are Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities outstanding, those Senior Subordinated Creditors whose Senior Subordinated Credit Participations aggregate more than 50% of the total Senior Subordinated Credit Participations at that time. “Second Lien Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under Second Lien Facilities and the principal amount of outstanding Second Lien Notes held by a Second Lien Noteholder. “Senior Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, amounts payable for terminated or closed out hedging obligations and amounts that would be payable in respect of hedging obligations if they were terminated or closed out at that time. “Senior Subordinated Credit Participations” refers to drawn and undrawn commitments under Senior Subordinated Facilities and the principal amount of outstanding Senior Subordinated Notes held by a Senior Subordinated Noteholder.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Payment Default”) has occurred and is continuing; or
Subsubsection Text: (ii) if the payment is of certain amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee, or an agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility in accordance with the original form of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents under which they are payable; (iii) if the payment is of certain administration and maintenance costs, expenses and taxes of the Issuer (in acting as a holding company of the Senior Subordinated Group and borrower or issuer of the Senior Subordinated Liabilities), including any reporting or listing requirement and costs and expenses of any security agent in relation to the protection, preservation or enforcement of such security; ----- (iv) unless a Senior Acceleration Event or Senior Secured Notes Acceleration Event has occurred, if the payment is of any amendment, consent and/or waiver fees and any related expenses incurred in respect of (or reasonably incidental to) the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents (including in relation to any reporting or listing requirements thereunder) which expressed as a percentage of the principal amount of the Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities (or the affected amount thereof), does not exceed the amount of the corresponding consent and/or waiver fee paid to the Senior Secured Creditors (when expressed as a percentage of the Senior Secured Liabilities (or the affected principal amount thereof)); (v) following the occurrence of a Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Event of Default which is continuing, if all or part of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities are released or otherwise discharged solely in consideration for the issues of shares in the Issuer (each, a “Debt for Equity Swap”) provided that no cash or cash equivalent payment is made in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities and any Liabilities owed by a member of the ICA Group to another member of the ICA Group, the Investor or any other holding company of the Issuer that arise as a result of any such Debt for Equity Swap are subordinated as Investor Liabilities pursuant to the Intercreditor Agreement and the Senior Secured Creditors and Second Lien Creditors are granted security in respect of any of those Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities owed by the Issuer; (vi) of any other amount not exceeding €1,000,000 (or its equivalent in other currencies) in aggregate in any twelve month period; or (vii) if the Majority Senior Secured Creditors and the Majority Second Lien Creditors give prior consent to that Payment being made. On or after the Priority Discharge Date, any member of the ICA Group may make payments to the Senior Subordinated Creditors (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Guarantee Liabilities) or a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only) then due in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents and Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (as applicable). _Payment Blockage Provisions_ Until the Priority Discharge Date, except with the Required Senior Consent, no Debtor shall make, (and the Issuer shall procure that no other member of the ICA Group will make) and no Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower nor any Senior Subordinated Creditor may receive from any member of the ICA Group, any Permitted Senior Subordinated Payment (other than Senior Subordinated Agent Amounts) if: (i) a Priority Payment Default is continuing; or (ii) a Priority Event of Default (other than a Priority Payment Default) is continuing, from the date which is one Business Day after the date on which the Common Security Agent (acting on the instructions of an Instructing Group) delivers a notice (a “Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice”) specifying the event or circumstance in relation to that Priority Event of Default to any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower and the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representatives until the earliest to occur of: (A) the date falling 179 days after delivery of that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice; (B) in relation to payments of Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities, if a Senior Subordinated Standstill Period is in effect at any time after delivery of that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice, the date on which that Senior Subordinated Standstill Period expires; (C) the date on which the relevant Priority Event of Default has been remedied or waived in accordance with the applicable Senior Secured Finance Documents or the Second Lien Finance Documents (as applicable); (D) the date on which the Common Security Agent delivers a notice to each Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower and the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representative(s) cancelling the Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice; (E) the Priority Discharge Date; and (F) the date on which the Common Security Agent or any Senior Creditor Representative or Second Lien creditor representative takes Enforcement Action permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement against a Debtor. Unless each of the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representatives and each Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower waives this requirement: (i) a new Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may not be delivered unless and until 360 days have elapsed since the delivery of the immediately prior Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice; and ----- (ii) no Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may be delivered by the Common Security Agent in reliance on a Priority Event of Default more than 45 days after the date it received notice of that Priority Event of Default. The Common Security Agent may only serve one Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice with respect to the same event or set of circumstances. Subject to the paragraph above, this shall not affect the right of the Common Security Agent to issue a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice in respect of any other event or set of circumstances. No Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice may be served by the Common Security Agent in respect of a Priority Event of Default which had been notified to the Common Security Agent at the time at which an earlier Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice was issued. Any failure to make a payment due under the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement as a result of the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default shall not prevent (i) the occurrence of an event of default as a consequence of that failure to make a payment in relation to the relevant Senior Subordinated Finance Document or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement; or (ii) the issue of an enforcement notice in respect of an event of default in respect of a Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes (a “Senior Subordinated Enforcement Notice”) on behalf of the Senior Subordinated Creditors. _Payment Obligations and Capitalization of Interest Continue_ No Debtor shall be released from the liability to make any payment (including of default interest, which shall continue to accrue) under any Senior Subordinated Finance Document or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement by the operation of the provisions set out under each section above under the caption “—Restrictions relating to Senior Subordinated Notes” even if its obligation to make such payment is restricted at any time by the terms of any of those provisions. The accrual and capitalization of interest (if any) in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents or Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement shall continue notwithstanding the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice. _Cure of Payment Stop_ If: (i) at any time following the issue of a Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or the occurrence of a Senior Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default, that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice ceases to be outstanding and/or (as the case may be) the Senior Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default ceases to be continuing; and (ii) the relevant Debtor then promptly pays to the Senior Subordinated Creditors or the Issuer (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only) an amount equal to any payments which had accrued under the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents or the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (as applicable) and which would have been Permitted Senior Subordinated Payments but for that Senior Subordinated Payment Stop Notice or Senior Secured Payment Default or Second Lien Payment Default (as the case may be), then any Senior Subordinated Event of Default (including any cross default or similar provision under any other Debt Document) which may have occurred as a result of that suspension of payments shall be waived and any Senior Subordinated Enforcement Notice which may have been issued as a result of that Senior Subordinated Event of Default shall be waived, in each case without any further action being required on the part of the Senior Subordinated Creditors or the Issuer (in respect of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Liabilities only). _Restrictions on Amendments and Waivers_ Subject to the following paragraph, the Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Senior Subordinated Creditors may amend or waive the terms of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents (other than the Intercreditor Agreement or any security document) in accordance with their respective terms at any time, subject to any consent required under them provided that the terms of the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents as so amended or waived are not prohibited by the terms of the Senior Secured Finance Documents and the Second Lien Finance Document or if Required Creditor Consent is obtained. ----- Prior to the Priority Discharge Date, the Issuer and any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower may not amend or waive the terms of the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement if such amendment or waiver would result in the Issuer being subject to more onerous obligations than those contained in the relevant Senior Subordinated Finance Document (under which the proceeds of the relevant Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes are borrowed or issued to be on-lent) to which the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement relates. This restriction shall not apply if such amendment or waiver relates to an increase in the applicable margin or coupon payable on the relevant Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement (provided that such margin or coupon (as the case may be) may be higher than the margin or coupon payable on the relevant Senior Subordinated Facility or Senior Subordinated Notes to which the Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement relates) to the extent it is customary for such Senior Subordinated Proceeds Loan Agreement at the date of borrowing or issuance thereunder, taking into account the then current market provided that to the extent it is necessary on the basis of a determination made in good faith by the board of directors of the Issuer (for which it can conclusively rely on the advice and feedback of its tax advisers). _Restrictions on Enforcement by Senior Subordinated Finance Party_ Until the Priority Discharge Date, except with the prior consent of or as required by the Instructing Group: (i) no Senior Subordinated Finance Party shall direct the Common Security Agent to enforce, or otherwise (to the extent applicable) require the enforcement of, any Common Collateral; and (ii) no Senior Subordinated Finance Party nor any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower shall take or require the taking of any Enforcement Action against a member of the ICA Group in relation to the Senior Subordinated Group Liabilities, except as permitted under the provisions set out under the caption “—Permitted Senior Subordinated Enforcement” below, _provided, however, that no such action required by an Instructing Group need be taken except to the extent such Instructing_ Group otherwise is entitled under the Intercreditor Agreement to direct such action. Any Senior Subordinated Creditor may at any time take any Enforcement Action against a Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower or any guarantor of Senior Subordinated Liabilities which is not a member of the ICA Group in each case in each case in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Finance Documents. “Enforcement Action” is defined as: (i) in relation to any liabilities: - the acceleration of any liabilities or the making of any declaration that any liabilities are prematurely due and payable (other than as a result of it becoming unlawful for a Senior Lender, a holder of Senior Secured Notes, a Second Lien Lender, a Second Lien Noteholder, a Senior Subordinated Lender or a holder of Senior Subordinated Notes to perform its obligations under, or of any voluntary or mandatory prepayment arising under, any of the Debt Documents); - the making of any declaration that any liabilities are payable on demand; - the making of a demand in relation to a liability that is payable on demand; - the making of any demand against any member of the ICA Group in relation to any guarantee liabilities of that member of the ICA Group; - the exercise of any right to require any member of the ICA Group to acquire any liability (including exercising any put or call option against any member of the ICA Group for the redemption or purchase of any liability but excluding any such right which arises as a result of the permitted debt purchase transactions provisions of the Credit Facilities Agreement (or any similar or equivalent provision of any other facility agreement documenting Senior Lender Liabilities other than the Credit Facilities Agreement and which is permitted by the Intercreditor Agreement (a “Permitted Senior Secured Facility Agreement”), the Senior Secured Notes finance documents, a Second Lien Facility Agreement, Second Lien Notes finance documents, a Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement or the Senior Subordinated Notes finance documents and excluding any mandatory offer arising as a result of a change of control or asset sale (however described) as set out in the finance documents relating to the Senior Secured Notes, Second Lien Notes or Senior Subordinated Notes) (or any other similar or equivalent provision of any Permitted Senior Secured Facilities Agreements, the Senior Secured Notes finance documents, a Second Lien Facility Agreement, the Second Lien Notes Finance Documents, the Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement or the Senior Subordinated Notes Finance Documents; ----- - the exercise of any right of set-off, account combination or payment netting against any member of the ICA Group in respect of any liabilities other than the exercise of any such right: - as close-out netting by a hedge counterparty or by a hedging ancillary lender or by a hedging bilateral facility lender; - as payment netting by a hedge counterparty or by a hedging ancillary lender or by a hedging bilateral facility lender; - as inter-hedging agreement netting by a hedge counterparty; - as inter-hedging ancillary document netting by a hedging ancillary lender; - as inter-hedging Bilateral Facility Document Netting by a hedging bilateral facility lender; and - which is otherwise permitted under the Credit Facilities Agreement, a Permitted Senior Secured Facility Agreement, Senior Secured Notes Finance Documents, a Second Lien Facility Agreement, Second Lien Notes Finance Documents, a Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement or the Senior Subordinated Notes Finance Documents in each case to the extent that the exercise of that right gives effect to a permitted payment under the Intercreditor Agreement; and - the suing for, commencing or joining of any legal or arbitration proceedings against any member of the Senior Subordinated Group to recover any liabilities; (ii) the premature termination or close-out of any hedging transaction under any hedging agreement (except to the extent permitted by the Intercreditor Agreement); (iii) the taking of any steps to enforce or require the enforcement of any security (including the crystallization of any floating charge forming part of the security but excluding any Ancillary Enforcement Rights); (iv) the entering into of any composition, compromise, assignment or similar arrangement with any member of the Senior Subordinated Group or any Third Party Security Provider which owes any liabilities, or has given any security, guarantee or indemnity or other assurance against loss in respect of the liabilities of the Senior Subordinated Group owed to a creditor under the Intercreditor Agreement (other than any action permitted under the Intercreditor Agreement or pursuant to any debt buy-back, tender offer, exchange offer or similar or equivalent arrangement not otherwise prohibited by the relevant finance documents and not undertaken as part of an announced restructuring or turnaround plan or while a default was outstanding under the relevant finance documents);
