Subordinated Liabilities) or in connection with or following the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the Common Collateral or a transaction in lieu of enforcement of Common Collateral and all amounts received by the Common Security Agent from another Creditor or any Foreclosed Asset Holder (for the purposes of this section, the “Group Recoveries”) shall be applied at any time as the Common Security Agent (in its discretion) sees fit, to the extent permitted by applicable law (and subject to the provisions of this section), in the following order of priority: (i) in discharging any sums owing to the Senior Agent (in respect of the amounts due to the Senior Agent), any receiver or delegate, the Common Security Agent, any Senior Secured Notes Trustee amounts, any sums owing to the Second Lien Agent in respect of the Second Lien Agent liabilities, any Second Lien Notes Trustee amounts, the Senior Subordinated Agent in respect of Senior Subordinated Agent liabilities, and any Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee amounts on a pari _passu basis;_ (ii) in payment of all costs and expenses incurred by any Agent or Secured Creditor in connection with any realization or enforcement of the Common Collateral taken in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement including any action taken in relation to the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process or any action taken at the request of the Common Security Agent under the Intercreditor Agreement; (iii) (if the Common Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), in payment or distribution to the Foreclosed Assets Holders of their Tax Liabilities (if any) (in each case on a pro rata and pari passu basis amongst themselves); (iv) (if the Common Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), in payment or distribution to the Foreclosed Assets Holders which have paid (or are liable to pay) all or part of any Soulte in connection with the enforcement of any Security Document in an amount equal to the amount of Soulte paid (or owed) by them (in each case on a pro rata and pari passu basis amongst themselves) but solely to the extent not already repaid to such Foreclosed Asset Holders by the relevant payee pursuant to a Clawback or in accordance with the turnover provisions; (v) subject to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement and unless by its terms such New Money has a lower ranking in this waterfall), in payment or distribution, or repayment of all costs, expenses, interest and principal amounts due to the relevant creditors under any New Money (if any) (in each case on a pro rata and pari passu basis amongst themselves); (vi) in payment to: (A) the Senior Agent on its own behalf and on behalf of the senior arrangers and the Senior Lenders; (B) each Senior Secured Notes Trustee on its own behalf and on behalf of the holders of the Senior Secured Notes; (C) the Bilateral Facility Lenders; and (D) certain hedge counterparties party to the Intercreditor Agreement, ----- for application towards the discharge of: (I) the liabilities of the arrangers of the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities and the Senior Lender Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Finance Documents); (II) the Senior Secured Notes Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Senior Secured Notes finance documents); and (III) the Bilateral Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the Bilateral Facility Documents); and (IV) the Hedging Liabilities (on a pro rata basis between the Hedging Liabilities of each hedge counterparty), on a pro rata and pari passu basis between paragraphs (I), (II), (III) and (IV) of this item (vi) above and the Replacement Costs calculated in relation to the relevant Senior Secured Liabilities referred to above which have become Affected Liabilities (other than amounts discharged pursuant to item (IV) above) on a pro rata basis and ranking pari passu between such paragraphs (I) to (IV) above; (vii) the Second Lien Agent (for itself and for the second lien arrangers and the Second Lien Lenders), and each Second Lien Notes Trustee (for itself and for the creditors in respect of the Second Lien Notes), for application towards the discharge of (I) the liabilities of the arrangers of the Second Lien Facilities and the Second Lien Lender Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Second Lien Facilities), and (II) the Second Lien Notes Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Second Lien Notes), and the Replacement Cost calculated on the relevant Second Lien Liabilities referred to above which have become Affected Liabilities (other than amounts discharged pursuant to item (iv) above) on a pro rata basis and ranking pari passu between themselves. On the Issue Date, no Second Lien Lender Liabilities or Second Lien Notes Liabilities will be outstanding. Such Liabilities may only be incurred if not prohibited under the terms of the Debt Documents, including, without limitation, the covenants applicable to the Notes; (viii) solely to the extent such proceeds are from the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the Common Collateral held by the Common Security Agent which is Parent Common Transaction Security, the Senior Subordinated Agent (for itself and for the senior unsecured arrangers and the Senior Subordinated Lenders), and each Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee (for itself and for the creditors in respect of the Senior Subordinated Notes), for application towards the discharge of (I) the liabilities of the arrangers of the Senior Subordinated Facilities and the Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Senior Subordinated Facilities), and (II) the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Senior Subordinated Notes), and the Replacement Cost calculated in the relevant Senior Subordinated Liabilities referred to above which have become Affected Liabilities on a _pro rata basis and ranking pari passu between themselves; (ix) if none of the Debtors is under any further actual or contingent liability under any of the Intercreditor Agreement or the finance documents relating to the Permitted Senior Secured Facilities, the Senior Secured Notes, the Second Lien Facilities, the Second Lien Notes, the Senior Subordinated Facilities and the Senior Subordinated Notes, in payment to any other person whom the Common Security Agent is obliged to pay in priority to any Debtor; (x) (if the Common Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), pro rata and pari passu amongst themselves: (A) to the Issuer, any member of the ICA Group, or any entity to which a Soulte has been paid or remains payable and, if paid, only to the extent paid back to the Foreclosed Instrument Holders by the relevant payee pursuant to a Clawback or in accordance with the turnover provisions or paragraph (iv) above; (B) to any relevant Debtor, in payment or distribution of the amount of the Assigned Recourse Rights Deferred Consideration; and (xi) the balance: (A) if any, in payment to the relevant Debtor; or (B) (if the Common Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), for the balance, to be applied in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement. _Order of Application of Independent Recoveries_ Subject to certain provisions in the Intercreditor Agreement, all Independent Recoveries shall be held by the Independent Security Agent on trust, to the extent legally permitted, to apply them at any time as the Independent Security Agent (in its ----- discretion) sees fit, to the extent permitted by applicable law (and subject to the provisions of this section), in the following order of priority: (i) in discharging any sums owing to the Senior Subordinated Creditor Representatives (in respect of the amounts due to the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee, any other Senior Subordinated notes trustee or an agent under a Senior Subordinated Facility), the Independent Security Agent, any receiver or delegate on a pari passu basis; (ii) in payment of all costs and expenses incurred by any agent or Senior Subordinated creditor in connection with any realization or enforcement of the Senior Subordinated Collateral taken in accordance with the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement or any action taken at the request of the Independent Security Agent under the Intercreditor Agreement; (iii) (if the Senior Subordinated Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), in payment or distribution to the Foreclosed Assets Holders of their Tax Liabilities (if any) (in each case on a pro rata and pari passu basis amongst themselves); (iv) (if the Senior Subordinated Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), in payment or distribution to the Foreclosed Assets Holders which have paid (or are liable to pay) all or part of any Soulte in connection with the enforcement of any Security Document in an amount equal to the amount of Soulte paid (or owed) by them (in each case on a pro rata and pari passu basis amongst themselves) but solely to the extent not already repaid to such Foreclosed Asset Holders by the relevant payee pursuant to a Clawback or in accordance with the turnover provisions; (v) the Senior Subordinated Agent (for itself and for the senior unsecured arrangers and the Senior Subordinated Lenders), and each Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee (for itself and for the creditors in respect of the Senior Subordinated Notes), for application towards the discharge of (I) the liabilities of the arrangers of the Senior Subordinated Facilities and the Senior Subordinated Facility Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Senior Subordinated Facilities), and (II) the Senior Subordinated Notes Liabilities (in accordance with the terms of the finance documents applicable to the Senior Subordinated Notes), on a pro rata basis and ranking pari passu between themselves, and Replacement Costs calculated in relation to the relevant Senior Subordinated Liabilities which have become Affected Liabilities (other than discharged pursuant to item (iv) above) on a pro rata and pari passu basis between paragraphs (I) and (II) above; (vi) if the Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower is under no further actual or contingent liability under any of the Intercreditor Agreement or the finance documents relating to the Senior Subordinated Facilities and the Senior Subordinated Notes, in payment to any other person whom the Independent Security Agent is obliged to pay in priority to the Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower; (vii) (if the Senior Subordinated Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), pro rata and pari passu amongst themselves: (A) to the Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower to which a Soulte has been paid or remains payable and, if paid, only to the extent paid back to the Foreclosed Instrument Holders by the Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower pursuant to a Clawback or in accordance with the turnover provisions or item (iv) above; (B) to any relevant Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower (other than the Issuer) in payment or distribution of the amount of the Assigned Recourse Rights Deferred Consideration; and (viii) the balance, if any (A), in payment to the relevant Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower; or (B) (if the Senior Subordinated Collateral Foreclosure Date has occurred), for the balance, to be applied in accordance with the Intercreditor Agreement. “Replacement Cost” means an amount payable to any Senior Secured Notes Creditor, any Senior Creditor or any Second Lien Creditor which is equal to the interest which would have accrued at the Replacement Rate (capitalized yearly) on a principal amount from time to time equal to the relevant Senior Secured Liabilities, Second Lien Liabilities and Senior Subordinated Liabilities which have become Affected Liabilities from time to time. “Replacement Rate” means in respect of any Senior Secured Liabilities, Second Lien Liabilities or Senior Subordinated Liabilities which have become Affected Liabilities, a rate per annum which is equal to the highest contractual rate (including default rate) which was applicable to such liabilities under the relevant Debt Documents on the date such liabilities have become Affected Liabilities. To the extent that the recoveries held by the Common Security Agent are insufficient to discharge the liabilities owed to all the creditors in any priority class and if and to the extent this is due to any creditor whose commitments, other participation rights (including by way of sub-participation) and/or any other rights and claims under the Debt Documents against an insolvent German Debtor would be subordinated or subject to potential avoidance claims pursuant to section 39 paragraph 1 no. 5 and/or paragraph 2 or section 135 of the German Insolvency Code (Insolvenzordnung) or section 6 of the German Avoidance Act (Anfechtungsgesetz) (an “Equitably Subordinated Creditor”) being part of that class of creditors, amongst others, the recoveries from German Debtors to be applied by the Security Agent in discharge of the liabilities of that class of creditors shall be ----- distributed to the other creditors of that class and the Equitably Subordinated Creditor shall not be entitled to receive the recoveries from German Debtors in discharge of any Equitably Subordinated Liabilities.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Rights” and Assigned Recourse Rights and the amount thereof at any time being herein referred to as the “Amount of Assigned Recourse Rights”).
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that if based on the valuation report prepared in connection with the Foreclosure over the shares in Bidco (the “Bidco Shares Foreclosure”) or the Foreclosure over the shares in Issuer or in any of the Issuers’s holding companies (the “Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure”), in accordance with the terms of the relevant Collateral, or in two other valuation reports prepared and delivered no more than 30 days after the relevant Foreclosure by different and independent investment banks of international repute at the request of Topco (and as approved by the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) acting reasonably), it is shown that the enterprise value (on a debt free/cash free basis) of the relevant Foreclosed Assets on the relevant Foreclosure Date exceeds: - in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure, by ten (10) per cent. the liabilities under the relevant Secured Debt Documents other than the Senior Subordinated Facility Finance Documents and the Senior Subordinated Notes Finance Documents (immediately prior to such Foreclosure); or - in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure, by ten (10) per cent. the liabilities under the relevant Secured Debt Documents, the Issuer (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) shall be entitled by notice to the Security Agent within one month following the delivery of the relevant above mentioned valuation report(s) (the “Sale Notice”) to request the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) to launch a process for the sale of the Foreclosed Assets (a “Sponsor Initiated Sale Process”). The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process shall be organized and run according to the following principles: (a) the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) shall manage all aspects of the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process, including the appointment of an investment bank or entity (the “Sale Expert”) to carry out an organized private auction process for the sale of the Foreclosed Assets with a view to obtaining the best price reasonably obtainable provided that the terms and conditions of the mandate letter of such Sale Expert shall provide for a remuneration scheme whereby such Sale Expert is incentivized to achieve such result; (b) the proposed sale will have to provide for the full and immediate repayment in cash of all Outstanding Liabilities (as defined below) up to the amount required to pay all amounts due under paragraphs (i) to (ix) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Common Recoveries” in case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure or under paragraphs (i) to (vi) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Independent Recoveries” in case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure (unless otherwise agreed between the relevant purchaser and the relevant Secured Parties); (c) no representations and warranties will be granted by the Secured Parties to the buyer save for customary representations and warranties with respect to the ownership of the Foreclosed Assets to be sold and the absence of Security thereon and that on the date of the transfer that they have the corporate power to effect that transfer and have taken all necessary action to authorise the making by them of that transfer; (d) the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) shall keep and the Issuer (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) informed on a regular basis on the progress made in respect of the sale process and the relevant Secured Parties and the Issuer (or as the case may be Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower) (which in each case shall be invited to participate in such auction) shall be entitled to involve any third-party bidder to participate in the auction; (e) the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process shall be no longer than four months from the launch of the process until the delivery of the final bids (demonstrated by the execution of a binding commitment for a price enabling the discharge in full of all Outstanding Liabilities up to the amount required to pay all amounts due under paragraphs (i) to (ix) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Common Recoveries” in case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure or under paragraphs (i) to (vi) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Independent Recoveries” in case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure (and, in either case, fully financed with customary certain funds provisions for any debt financing), provided ----- that the Common Security Agent shall communicate to Topco any non-binding indicative offers delivered in the first round of consultation launched in respect of such Sponsor Initiated Sale Process, and the Senior Secured Creditors and the Second Lien Creditors may request the termination of the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process if none of such non-binding indicative offers enables the discharge in full of all Outstanding Liabilities up to the amount required to pay all amounts due under paragraphs (i) to (ix) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Common Recoveries in case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure or under paragraphs (i) to (vi) in the payment waterfall described in “Order of Application of Independent Recoveries in case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure; (f) the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) shall be obliged to sell the Foreclosed Assets to the buyer designated in accordance with these provisions to the extent only that (x) the sale is completed within seven months of the Sale Notice and (y) all the relevant Outstanding Liabilities as referred to in the above paragraphs are fully discharged in cash as a result of such sale of the Foreclosed Assets; and (g) subject to the foregoing, the Common Security Agent (in the case of a Bidco Shares Foreclosure) or the Independent Security Agent (in the case of a Parent Guarantor Shares Foreclosure) shall retain the best bid based on the recommendations of the Sale Expert (taking into account all undertakings, guarantees and indemnities to be given by the Secured Creditors). The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that the Sponsor Initiated Sale Process may not be initiated more than once. “Outstanding Liabilities” means the Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, the Bilateral Lender Liabilities, the Second Lien Lender Liabilities, the Second Lien Notes Liabilities and the Senior Subordinated Liabilities (and the Assigned Recourse Rights relating thereto).

Subsubsection Title: Option to purchase: Topco Call Option
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that, Topco (or any Holding Company of Topco) may after the taking of any Enforcement Action by the Secured Parties (or by any person on their behalf), by giving not less than 10 days’ notice to the relevant Security Agent, (x) require the transfer (a “Outstanding Liabilities Transfer”) to it (or to any person acting on its behalf it may designate) of all, but not part, of the rights, benefits and obligations in respect of the Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, the Bilateral Lender Liabilities, the Second Lien Lender Liabilities, the Second Lien Notes Liabilities and the Senior Subordinated Liabilities (and the Assigned Recourse Rights relating thereto), (the “Outstanding

Subsection Title: Rights” and Assigned Recourse Rights and the amount thereof at any time being herein referred to as the “Amount of Assigned Recourse Rights”).
Subsubsection Text: The consideration (the “Assigned Recourse Rights Deferred Consideration”) for the assignment of the Assigned Recourse Rights shall be equal to the Amount of Assigned Recourse Rights but shall be payable only to the extent and when there are enough cash proceeds to be applied by the Common Security Agent (in respect of Common Collateral) or the Independent Security Agent (in respect of Senior Subordinated Collateral) to pay such Assigned Recourse Rights Deferred Consideration in accordance with the waterfall provisions of the Intercreditor Agreement as described under “Application of proceeds” below.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Liabilities”)—or (y) procure the full discharge (by it or any person acting on its behalf it may designate) of such Outstanding
Subsubsection Text: Subject to certain other terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the Intercreditor Agreement will provide that if, for any reason, any Senior Secured Liabilities remain unpaid after the Enforcement Date and the resulting losses are not borne by the Senior Secured Creditors in the proportions which their respective exposures at the Enforcement Date bore to the aggregate exposures of all the Senior Secured Creditors at the Enforcement Date, the Senior Secured Creditors will make such payments amongst themselves as the Common Security Agent shall require to put the Senior Secured Creditors in such a position that (after taking into account such payments) those losses are borne in those proportions. No Equitably Subordinated Lender shall have any rights or claims in relation to any proceeds received from an insolvent German Debtor or the enforcement of the Transaction Security provided by such insolvent German Debtor and shall turn over all such proceeds to such Creditors as the Security Agent shall require. _Equalization: Soulte payments_ The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that if, for any reason, following a Foreclosure certain Secured Parties have not paid their share of the corresponding resulting Soulte (if any), such Secured Parties will make such payments amongst themselves ----- as the Security Agent shall require to put the Secured Parties in such a position that (after taking into account such payments) the amount paid or payable in respect of such corresponding Soulte is borne by all the Secured Parties having participated in such Foreclosure in the proportions which their respective Exposures at the date of the Foreclosure bore to the aggregate Exposures of all such Secured Creditors at the date of the Foreclosure.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Liabilities”)—or (y) procure the full discharge (by it or any person acting on its behalf it may designate) of such Outstanding
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement permits, in certain circumstances and subject to certain conditions, for the implementation of any existing, additional, supplemental or new financing arrangement in respect of any of the liabilities, including by way of refinancing, replacement, increase or otherwise of any such new, existing, additional, supplemental or new financing arrangement under such finance documents (each an “Additional Debt Financing”). Such Additional Debt Financing may be made on a basis which is senior to, pari passu with or junior to any of the other liabilities, may benefit from any or all of the security or may be unsecured, and may be effected in whole or in part by way of a debt exchange, non-cash rollover or other similar or equivalent transaction, in each case subject to the terms of the Secured Debt Documents. Subject to compliance with applicable provisions of the Secured Debt Documents each Party shall be required to enter into any amendment to or replacement of the then current Secured Debt Documents (including for the purpose of reflecting the terms and ranking of any Additional Debt Financing in the Secured Debt Documents and/or take such other action as is reasonably required by the Issuer (in each case at the cost of the Issuer) in order to facilitate any Additional Debt Financing, including in relation to any changes to, the taking of, or the release coupled with the retaking of, any guarantee or Security, provided that the Security Agent shall not be required to execute a release of assets from any existing security pursuant to this paragraph unless the Issuer has confirmed in writing to the Security Agent that it has determined in good faith (taking into account any applicable legal limitations and other relevant considerations in relation to the Additional Debt Financing) that it is not possible to implement the Additional Debt Financing by either granting additional security and/or amending the terms of the existing security. Each Agent and the Security Agent is irrevocably authorized and instructed by each Party (other than the Debtors and Topco), each Secured Party and each Secured Creditor to execute any such amended or replacement Secured Debt Documents and/or take such action on behalf of the Parties, the Secured Parties and the Secured Creditors (and shall promptly do so on the request of and at the cost of the Issuer). Where required to permit the creation of any lower ranking security in connection with any Additional Debt Financing, the beneficiaries of any Transaction Security will consent in the Intercreditor Agreement to any such lower ranking security being created for the purpose of such Additional Debt Financing. The provisions contained in this section shall not operate so as to override any provision in any Debt Financing Agreement which would (i) require the unanimous consent of any of the Senior Lenders, Bilateral Lenders, Hedge Counterparties, Senior Secured Noteholders, Second Lien Lenders, Second Lien Noteholders, Senior Subordinated Lenders or Topco Noteholders as applicable under the terms of any of the Debt Financing Agreements or (ii) expressly require the consent of any individual affected class of Secured Creditors or any individual affected Secured Creditor under the terms of any of the Debt Financing Agreements.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Liabilities”)—or (y) procure the full discharge (by it or any person acting on its behalf it may designate) of such Outstanding
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that, subject to certain exceptions, its terms may be amended or waived only with the consent of the Issuer and the relevant Agents, provided that, to the extent that an amendment, waiver or consent only affects one class of Creditors, and such amendment, waiver or consent could not reasonably be expected materially and adversely to affect the interests of the other classes of Creditors, only written agreement from the agent acting on behalf of the affected class shall be required. Subject to certain exceptions under the Intercreditor Agreement, an amendment or waiver of the Intercreditor Agreement shall not be made without the consent of: (i) if the relevant amendment or waiver (the “Proposed Amendment”) is prohibited by the Credit Facilities Agreement and/or any Permitted Senior Secured Facility Agreement, the Senior Agent (acting on the instructions of the requisite Senior Lenders in accordance with the Credit Facilities Agreement); (ii) if the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the relevant Senior Secured Notes Indenture, the Senior Secured Notes Trustee; (iii) if any indebtedness has been incurred under a Second Lien Facility Agreement and the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the Second Lien Facility Agreement, the Second Lien Agent (acting on the instructions of the requisite Second Lien Lenders in accordance with the Second Lien Facility Agreement); ----- (iv) if any Second Lien Notes have been issued and the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the relevant Second Lien Notes Indenture, the Second Lien Notes Trustee; (v) if any indebtedness has been incurred under a Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement and the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement, the Senior Subordinated Agent (acting on the instructions of the requisite Senior Subordinated Lenders in accordance with the Senior Subordinated Facility Agreement); (vi) if the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the relevant Senior Subordinated Notes Indenture, the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee; (vii) if any indebtedness has been incurred under a Bilateral Facility Document and the Proposed Amendment is prohibited by the terms of the Bilateral Facility Document, the Bilateral Facility Lender providing that Facility; (viii) if a hedge counterparty is providing hedging to a Debtor under a hedging agreement, that hedge counterparty (in each case only to the extent that the relevant amendment or waiver adversely affects the continuing rights and/or obligations of that hedge counterparty; (ix) Topco; and (x) the Issuer. The Intercreditor Agreement may be amended by the Agents, each Security Agent and the Issuer without the consent of any other party thereto, to cure defects, omissions or resolve ambiguities or inconsistencies or reflect changes of a minor, technical or administrative nature. _Amendments and Waivers: Security Documents_ Subject to certain exceptions under the Intercreditor Agreement, the relevant Security Agent may, if authorized by an Instructing Group in the case of the Common Collateral or the Majority Senior Subordinated Creditors in the case of the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral, and if the Issuer, in the case of the Common Collateral, or any Senior Subordinated Issuer/Borrower, in the case of the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral, consents, amend the terms of, waive any of the requirements of or grant consents under, any of the security documents which shall be binding on each party. Subject to certain exceptions under the Intercreditor Agreement, in the case of any amendment or waiver of, or consent under, any security document governing the Common Collateral which would adversely affect the nature or scope of the charged property or the manner in which the proceeds of enforcement of the Common Collateral are distributed that amendment, waiver or consent shall require approval in accordance with the provisions set out above under the captions “—Required Consents.” Subject to certain exceptions under the Intercreditor Agreement, in the case of any amendment or waiver of, or consent under, any security document governing the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral which would adversely affect the nature or scope of the charged property or the manner in which the proceeds of enforcement of the Senior Subordinated Notes Collateral are distributed that amendment, waiver or consent shall require approval in accordance with the provisions set out above under the captions “—Required Consents.” _Exceptions_ Subject to the paragraph below and certain other exceptions under the Intercreditor Agreement, an amendment, waiver or consent which adversely relates to the express rights or obligations of an Agent, an arranger or the a Security Agent (in each case in such capacity) may not be effected without the consent of that Agent or, as the case may be, that arranger or the relevant Security Agent (as the case may be) at such time. Neither of the preceding paragraph nor the first paragraph of the section above captioned “—Amendments and Waivers: Security Documents” shall apply: - to any release of security, claim or liabilities; or - to any consent, which, in each case, the Security Agent gives in accordance with the provisions set out in the caption “—Proceeds of Disposals” above. ----- _Agreement to Override_ Unless expressly stated otherwise in the Intercreditor Agreement, the Intercreditor Agreement overrides anything in the Debt Documents to the contrary (other than any Transaction Security governed by German Law).

Subsubsection Title: Thin Cap Limitations for Certain Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in any other Debt Document, the aggregate amount of the guarantee liabilities of the Issuer and the guarantee liabilities of the Issuer’s direct and indirect Subsidiaries in their capacity as guarantors of the secured obligations of Bidco under the relevant Secured Debt Documents (taken as a whole and taking into account any other guarantee limitations in the relevant Secured Debt Documents) (any such guarantee from the Issuer or that from any of the Issuer’s direct and indirect Subsidiaries shall be referred to as a “Relevant

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Liabilities”)—or (y) procure the full discharge (by it or any person acting on its behalf it may designate) of such Outstanding
Subsubsection Text: Liabilities if: (i) in the case of a Outstanding Liabilities Transfer, that transfer is lawful; (ii) the relevant Agent, the Senior Secured Notes Trustee, the Second Lien Notes Trustee and Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee, on behalf of the relevant Secured Creditors are paid an amount equal to the aggregate of: (A) all of the Outstanding Liabilities (whether or not due), including (without double counting) all amounts that would have been payable under the relevant Debt Document if such Outstanding Liabilities were being prepaid by the relevant Debtors on the date of that payment; and (B) in the case of a Outstanding Liabilities Transfer, all costs and expenses incurred by the relevant Agent, the Senior Secured Notes Trustee, the Second Lien Notes Trustee, the Senior Subordinated Notes Trustee and/or the relevant Creditors as a consequence of giving effect to that transfer; (iii) as a result of that transfer the Secured Creditors have no further actual or contingent liabilities to any Debtor under the relevant Debt Documents; (iv) an indemnity is provided from Topco or any of its Holding Companies (or from another third party acceptable to the Secured Creditors) in a form reasonably satisfactory to each Secured Creditor in respect of all losses which may be sustained or incurred by any Secured Creditor in consequence of any sum received or recovered by any Secured Creditor from any person being required (or it being alleged that it is required) to be paid back by or clawed back from any Secured Creditor for any reason; (v) in the case of an Outstanding Liabilities Transfer, the transfer is made without recourse to, or representation or warranty from, the Secured Creditors, except that each relevant Secured Creditor shall be deemed to have represented and warranted on the date of that transfer that it has the corporate power to effect that transfer and it has taken all necessary action to authorise the making by it of that transfer; and (vi) Exercise of Topco’s call option as described in the above paragraphs and subsequent completion of the Outstanding Liabilities Transfer (and payment of the purchase price) or the relevant discharge of the Outstanding Liabilities shall be ----- completed not later than the earlier of (x) two months after the Foreclosure Date and (y) the date on which the Secured Parties or a Secured Parties SPV have initiated a disposal process in respect of the Foreclosed Assets (other than for the avoidance of doubt a sale to a Secured Parties SPV), provided that such process shall only be deemed to have been initiated once process letters have been distributed to the bidders and provided further for the avoidance of doubt that if a notice of exercise of the option has been given in accordance with paragraph (a) above prior to the initiation of a disposal process, the call option shall be permitted to be completed at the end of the 10 day notice period referred to above. The Outstanding Liabilities Transfer shall apply to the then outstanding Senior Lender Liabilities, Senior Secured Notes Liabilities, the Second Lien Lender Liabilities, the Second Lien Notes Liabilities and the Senior Subordinated Liabilities (including the Affected Liabilities relating thereto). If Topco has exercised the call option described in the paragraphs above and the relevant transfers have not been completed within the above mentioned period for any reason attributable to Topco, the right of the relevant entity to request a Sponsor Initiated Sale Process terminates. Unless agreed with the relevant hedging counterparty, Topco may only require an Outstanding Liabilities Transfer or procure the discharge of the outstanding liabilities if, at the same time, it procures the full discharge of the Hedging Liabilities or requires a full transfer to it of the Hedging Liabilities for consideration in the amount that would have been payable under such hedging obligations had they been terminated on such date plus certain costs and expenses in connection with any such purchase. _Liabilities of the Second Lien Issuer/Borrower_ Subject to certain provisions in the Intercreditor Agreement, all amounts from time to time received or recovered by a Security Agent from a Second Lien Issuer/Borrower (to the extent relating to Liabilities in respect of Second Lien Notes and/or any Second Lien Facility Agreement where the Second Lien Issuer/Borrower is the issuer or, as the case may be, the borrower of such Liabilities) pursuant to the terms of any Second Lien Finance Document (other than in connection with the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the security) shall be held by the relevant Security Agent on trust to apply them at any time as the relevant Security Agent (in its discretion) sees fit, to the extent permitted by applicable law in the following order of priority: (i) in accordance with paragraph (i) of the provision set out in “—Order of Application of Common Recoveries” above; (ii) in accordance with paragraph (ii) of the provision set out in “—Order of Application of Common Recoveries” above; (iii) in accordance with paragraphs (vii) of the provision set out in “—Order of Application of Common Recoveries” above; and (iv) the balance in accordance with the provisions set out in “—Order of Application of Common Recoveries” above. The Intercreditor Agreement will provide that each Secured Party authorizes the relevant Security Agent to hold any non-cash consideration received or recovered in connection with the realization or enforcement of all or any part of the security until cash is received for any such non-cash consideration, provided that the relevant Security Agent may distribute any such noncash consideration to a Secured Party which has agreed, on terms satisfactory to the relevant Security Agent, to receive such non-cash consideration and the liabilities owed to that Secured Party shall be reduced by an amount equal to the value of that non-cash consideration upon receipt by that Secured Party of that non-cash consideration.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Guarantee”) shall not exceed an amount (the “Relevant Maximum Guaranteed Amount”), which if exceeded would result
Subsubsection Text: in interest payments not being deductible by Bidco for corporate income tax purposes when compared to the position that would have been applicable in the absence of such guarantee and indemnity obligations. Any limitation of a Relevant Guarantee to the Relevant Maximum Guaranteed Amount and any further reduction (if any) of the Relevant Maximum Guaranteed Amount, pursuant to the foregoing provisions, shall be applied against each Relevant Guarantee in the following priority and order: (i) first, to the Relevant Maximum Guaranteed Amount of the Issuer (the “Parent Maximum Guaranteed Amount”); (ii) second, if the Parent Maximum Guaranteed Amount has been reduced to zero, to the Relevant Guarantee of each other guarantor pro rata to the obligations of each of such guarantors under their respective Relevant Guarantee. The Intercreditor Agreement will also state that, any reduction in the Relevant Maximum Amount of a Relevant Guarantee pursuant to the foregoing provisions shall be further applied against the remaining liabilities of the relevant guarantor under its Relevant Guarantee as follows: (iii) first, in reduction of the liabilities of the relevant guarantor under its Relevant Guarantee which are not Senior Secured Liabilities, pro rata the obligations of each of such guarantors under all of their Relevant Guarantees; and (iv) second, in reduction of the liabilities of the relevant guarantor under its Relevant Guarantee when such liabilities are Senior Secured Liabilities, pro rata the obligations of such guarantors under all of their Relevant Guarantees. The Intercreditor will also specify that Common Transaction Security granted by the Issuer over the shares in Bidco and over receivables held by the Issuer against Bidco (as third party security for the borrowing obligations of Bidco) will not be subject to the limitations arising from thin capitalization.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Certain of our affiliates in the Netherlands, France, Belgium and the United Kingdom, and potentially other jurisdictions, intend to enter into a trade receivables assignment program (the “TRA Programme”) involving the sale of certain receivables of eligible corporate debtors resident in certain jurisdictions. Our affiliates have signed a mandate letter with a financial institution in respect of the TRA Programme that is subject to customary conditions to closing. The purchase price for each sale of receivables will be calculated based on the face value of the receivables, less certain discounts and programme fees. Each sale will be without recourse against the seller, subject to customary exceptions for a receivables assignment programme of this type. The maximum aggregate amount of the TRA Programme is expected to be set at GBP 45 million and EUR 105 million and the TRA Programme is expected to be initially available to purchase receivables for 36 months. -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: In this description, the term “Issuer” refers only to Titan Holdings II, B.V. and not to any of its Subsidiaries, and the terms “we,” “our,” “us” and “the Company” each refer collectively to the Issuer and its consolidated Subsidiaries. For purposes of this Description of the Notes, the €375 million of       % senior notes due 2029 are referred to as the “notes.” The notes will be issued pursuant to a senior notes indenture (the “Indenture”), to be dated as of the Issue Date, among the Issuer, Deutsche Trustee Company Limited, as trustee (the “Trustee”), Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, as principal paying agent and transfer agent, Deutsche Bank Luxembourg S.A., as registrar, and Deutsche Bank AG, London Branch, as the security agent (the “Security Agent”). Copies of the Indenture (and any supplemental indentures) may be obtained from the Issuer upon request after the Issue Date. The notes will be issued in private transactions that are not subject to the registration requirements of the Securities Act, and the Indenture will not be qualified under or subject to and will not incorporate (by reference or otherwise) any of the provisions of, the U.S. Trust Indenture Act of 1939, as amended. Application will be made for the notes to be listed on the Official List of The International Stock Exchange (the “Exchange”) and for permission to be granted to deal in the notes on the Official List of the Exchange. There can be no assurance that this application will be accepted. The following summary of certain provisions of the Indenture, the Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Charge, the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Documents and the notes does not purport to be complete and is subject to, and is qualified in its entirety by reference to, all the provisions of the Indenture, the Escrow Agreement, the Escrow Charge, the Intercreditor Agreement, the Security Documents and the notes, including the definitions of certain terms therein. Capitalized terms used in this “Description of the Notes” section and not otherwise defined herein have the meanings set forth in the Indenture. The Issuer will issue the notes with an initial aggregate principal amount of €375 million. Following the Issue Date, the Issuer may issue additional notes from time to time as described below under “—Additional Notes.” This offering is currently expected to be consummated prior to the consummation of the Acquisition. If this offering does close prior to the consummation of the Acquisition, pursuant to the terms of an escrow agreement (the “Escrow Agreement”), to be dated as of the Issue Date, among the Issuer, the Trustee and an escrow agent (the “Escrow Agent”), the gross proceeds of the offering of the notes will be deposited into an escrow account (the “Escrow Account”) with the Escrow Agent. The Escrow Agreement, including the conditions to the release of the escrowed proceeds, are more fully described below under “—Escrow _of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption.” In the event the Acquisition has not been consummated on or before October_ 22, 2021 (the “Escrow Longstop Date”), or upon the occurrence of certain other events, the notes will be redeemed at a price equal to 100% of the initial issue price of the notes and accrued and unpaid interest and Additional Amounts, if any, from the Issue Date to, but not including, the Special Mandatory Redemption Date (the “Special Mandatory Redemption Price”). See “—Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption.” If a holder has given wire transfer instructions to the Issuer or a Paying Agent, the Paying Agent will deliver payment of all principal, interest and premium, if any, and Additional Amounts, if any, on that holder’s notes in accordance with those instructions. All other payments on the notes will be payable, and the notes may be exchanged or transferred, at the office or agency of a Paying Agent as specified in the Indenture unless the paying agent elects to make interest payments by check mailed to the holders at their addresses set forth in the register of holders. The notes will be issued only in fully registered form, without coupons, in denominations of €100,000 and integral multiples of €1,000 in excess thereof. Notes in denominations of less than €100,000 will not be available.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Brief Description of the Notes and the Guarantees
Subsubsection Text: The notes will be: - general senior secured obligations of the Issuer; - secured as set forth under “—Security; Intercreditor Agreement;” - equal in right of payment to all of the Issuer’s existing and future Indebtedness and other obligations that are not, by their terms, expressly subordinated in right of payment to the notes; - effectively subordinated to all existing and future secured Indebtedness and other obligations of the Issuer and its subsidiaries that are secured by assets that do not secure the notes, or that are secured on a first-priority basis over assets that secure the notes on a second-priority basis (including the Indebtedness Incurred under the Credit Agreement and certain Hedging Obligations), to the extent of the value of the assets securing such Indebtedness or such other obligations, and to any creditor having a preferred claim by operation of law, to the extent of the value of such preferred claim; and ----- - structurally subordinated to all indebtedness and other obligations of the Issuer’s existing and future Subsidiaries that do not Guarantee the notes as set forth under “—Guarantees”, including obligations to trade creditors. The Guarantees of each Guarantor in respect of the notes will be: - a general senior subordinated obligation of such Guarantor; - secured as set forth under “—Security; Intercreditor Agreement;” - equal in right of payment to all of such Guarantor’s existing and future senior subordinated indebtedness that is not expressly subordinated in right of payment to the Guarantees; - subordinated in right of payment to any of such Guarantor’s existing and future Senior Indebtedness, including its guarantee under the Credit Agreement and certain Hedging Obligations; - effectively subordinated to all existing and future secured Indebtedness and other obligations of such Guarantor that are secured by assets that do not secure its guarantee or that are secured on a first-priority basis over assets that secure the Guarantees on a second-priority basis (including the Indebtedness Incurred under the Credit Agreement and certain Hedging Obligations), to the extent of the value of the assets securing such Indebtedness or such other obligations, and to any creditor having a preferred claim by operation of law, to the extent of the value of such preferred claim; and - structurally subordinated to any existing and future indebtedness of subsidiaries of such Guarantor that do not Guarantee the Notes, including obligations to trade creditors. At March 31, 2021, on a pro forma basis after giving effect to the Transactions, we would have had €1,550 million of total indebtedness outstanding, including €1,175 million of secured indebtedness outstanding, excluding lease liabilities, nonrecourse factoring transactions, unamortized discounts and debt issuance costs and €275 million of undrawn availability under our revolving credit facility (without giving effect to letters of credit that may be issued under our revolving credit facility). Although the Indenture will limit the Incurrence of Indebtedness and the issuance of Disqualified Stock by the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries and the issuance of Preferred Stock by the Issuer’s Restricted Subsidiaries, such limitation is subject to a number of significant qualifications and exceptions. Under certain circumstances, the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries may be able to incur substantial amounts of Indebtedness, and such Indebtedness may be secured Indebtedness. The Indenture will not limit the amount of Indebtedness that any direct or indirect parent company of the Issuer may incur or the incurrence of liabilities that do not constitute Indebtedness. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes—The substantial indebtedness _of Titan Group could materially adversely affect our business, financial position and results of operations and prevent it from fulfilling its obligations under its indebtedness,” “—Certain Covenants—Liens” and “—Certain Covenants—Limitation on Incurrence of Indebtedness and Issuance of Disqualified Stock and Preferred Stock.”_ The Guarantees are senior subordinated indebtedness, which means that, pursuant to the terms of the Intercreditor Agreement, the Guarantees rank behind, and are expressly subordinated to, all existing and future Senior Indebtedness of the Guarantors, including any obligations under the Credit Agreement and any other Indebtedness ranking pari passu with or senior to such Indebtedness incurred after the Issue Date. The ability to take enforcement action against the Guarantors is subject to significant restrictions imposed by the Intercreditor Agreement, and potentially any Additional Intercreditor Agreements entered into after the Issue Date. In addition, the Guarantees and the collateral securing the notes are subject to release under certain circumstances, including, but not limited to, the sale of the TLB Borrower or a Restricted Subsidiary pursuant to an enforcement of security over shares of the TLB Borrower or a Restricted Subsidiary taken by the Security Agent acting at the direction of an instructing group of senior secured creditors. See “Description of Certain Financing and Guarantee Arrangements—The _Intercreditor Agreement”. It is therefore likely that holders of Senior Indebtedness and other creditors (including trade creditors)_ of the Guarantors would recover disproportionately more than the holders of the notes recover in any insolvency or similar proceeding relating to such entity. In any such case, there may be insufficient assets, or no assets, remaining to pay the principal of or interest on the notes after the repayment in full of all Senior Indebtedness. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Notes— _Investors’ right to receive payments on the Notes and Guarantees is contractually and effectively subordinated to certain of Titan Group’s indebtedness and obligations, including borrowings under the Credit Facilities Agreement, possible future borrowings as well as indebtedness and obligations of Titan Group’s subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Notes”_

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: On the Issue Date and as of the Acquisition Closing Date, all of the Issuer’s Subsidiaries will be Restricted Subsidiaries. In the circumstances described below under “—Certain Definitions—Unrestricted Subsidiary,” the Issuer will be permitted to designate Restricted Subsidiaries as Unrestricted Subsidiaries. Unrestricted Subsidiaries will not be subject to any of the restrictive covenants in the Indenture. -----

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Escrow of Proceeds; Special Mandatory Redemption
Subsubsection Text: Concurrently with the closing of the offering of the notes on the Issue Date, the Issuer will enter into the Escrow Agreement with the Trustee and the Escrow Agent, pursuant to which the Initial Purchasers will deposit with the Escrow Agent an amount equal to the gross proceeds of this offering of the Notes. The initial funds deposited in the Escrow Account, and all other funds, securities, interest, dividends, distributions and other proceeds and payments credited to the Escrow Account, including any interest earned on the amounts held in the Escrow Account (less any proceeds and/or funds paid in accordance with the Escrow Agreement) are referred to, collectively, as the “Escrowed Proceeds.” In order for the Issuer to cause the Escrow Agent to release the Escrowed Proceeds to the Issuer (the “Release”), the Escrow Agent and the Trustee shall have received from the Issuer, on or before the Escrow Longstop Date, an Officer’s Certificate, upon which both the Escrow Agent and the Trustee shall be entitled to rely absolutely without further investigation, to the effect that all of the following conditions have been met or will be satisfied on or prior to the Business Day immediately following the Escrow Longstop Date: (1) (i) the Acquisition will be consummated promptly upon release of the Escrowed Proceeds and (ii) since the Issue Date, no material term or condition of the Acquisition Agreement has been amended or waived in a manner or to an extent that would be materially prejudicial to the interests of holders, other than any amendment or waiver made with the consent of holders of a majority of the outstanding notes; and (2)as at the date of such Officer’s Certificate, there is no Default or Event of Default with respect to the Issuer under clause (6) or (11) of the first paragraph under the heading titled “Events of Default” below. The Release will occur promptly upon the receipt of such Officer’s Certificate. Upon the Release, the Escrowed Proceeds will be paid out in accordance with the Escrow Agreement and the Escrow Account will be reduced to zero. In the event that (a) the satisfaction of the conditions set forth above does not take place on or prior to the Escrow Longstop Date, (b) in the reasonable judgment of the Issuer, the Acquisition will not be consummated on or prior to the Escrow Longstop Date, (c) the Acquisition Agreement terminates at any time on or prior to the Escrow Longstop Date or (d) there is a Default or an Event of Default with respect to the Issuer under clause (6) of the first paragraph under the heading titled “Events of _Default” below on or prior to the Escrow Longstop Date (the date of any such event being the “Special Termination Date”),_ the Issuer will redeem all of the notes (the “Special Mandatory Redemption”) at a price (the “Special Mandatory

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsection Title: Redemption Price”) equal to 100% of the aggregate issue price of the notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest and Additional
Subsubsection Text: Amounts, if any, from the Issue Date to but excluding the Special Mandatory Redemption Date (as defined below) (subject to the right of holders of record on the relevant record date to receive interest due on the relevant interest payment date). Notice of the Special Mandatory Redemption will be delivered by the Issuer, no later than one Business Day following the Special Termination Date, to the Trustee and the Escrow Agent, and will provide that the Notes shall be redeemed on a date that is no later than the fifth Business Day after such notice is given by the Issuer in accordance with the terms of the Escrow Agreement (the “Special Mandatory Redemption Date”). On the Special Mandatory Redemption Date, the Escrow Agent shall pay to the Principal Paying Agent for payment to each holder the Special Mandatory Redemption Price for such holder’s notes and, concurrently with the payment to such holders, deliver any excess Escrowed Proceeds (if any) to the Issuer. Notice of such Special Mandatory Redemption shall be given to the holders of the notes at least five Business Days before the Special Mandatory Redemption Date. In the event that the Special Mandatory Redemption Price payable upon such Special Mandatory Redemption exceeds the amount of the Escrowed Proceeds, one or more of the Sponsors will, pursuant to a commitment provided by such Sponsors, be required to fund the difference between the Special Mandatory Redemption Price and the amount of the Escrowed Proceeds to cover the accrued and unpaid interest, and Additional Amounts, if any, owing to the holders of the Notes and any negative interest charged on the Escrow Account (the “Equity Commitment Letter”). See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the _Acquisition—If the Acquisition is not completed, you may not obtain the return that you expect on the Notes.” The Holders will_ not have any right to enforce the Equity Commitment Letter, and must rely on the Issuer’s sole right to enforcement under the Equity Commitment Letter. To secure the payment of the Special Mandatory Redemption Price, the Issuer will grant to the Trustee for the benefit of the holders (by virtue of a parallel debt arrangement set forth in the Indenture) a first-ranking security interest over the Escrow Account pursuant to an escrow charge dated the Issue Date between the Issuer and the Trustee (the “Escrow Charge”). Receipt by the Trustee of a notice of Special Mandatory Redemption or the occurrence of the Release shall each constitute deemed consent by the Trustee for the release of the Escrowed Proceeds from the Escrow Charge. ----- If at the time of such Special Mandatory Redemption, the Notes are listed on the Official List of the Exchange and the rules of the Exchange so require, the Issuer will notify the Exchange that the Special Mandatory Redemption has occurred and of any relevant details relating to such Special Mandatory Redemption. The Issuer or any of its Subsidiaries may act as paying agent or registrar in respect of the notes. No provisions of the Escrow Agreement or the Escrow Charge and, to the extent such provisions relate to the Issuer’s obligation to redeem the Notes in a Special Mandatory Redemption, the Indenture, may be waived or modified in any manner materially adverse to the holders without the consent of holders of a majority of the outstanding notes. By accepting a note, each holder will be deemed to have agreed to be bound by the terms of the Escrow Agreement and have irrevocably authorized the Trustee to take all the actions set forth in the Escrow Agreement without the need for further direction from them under the Indenture.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Pursuant to the Security Documents to be entered into on or prior to the Completion Date, the notes have been or will be secured by: (1) on a first-ranking basis, a pledge of (i) the shares held in the Issuer by Topco, (ii) the receivables owed to Topco by the Issuer or any Restricted Subsidiary of the Issuer in respect of any shareholder loan and (iii) the material bank accounts of the Issuer (together the “Notes Priority Collateral”); and (2) (to the extent the same secures the Indebtedness under the Credit Agreement on a first-ranking basis) on a second-ranking basis, (i) a pledge of the shares held in the TLB Borrower by the Issuer and (ii) a pledge of the structural loan receivables owed by the TLB Borrower to the Issuer (if any), (together the “Collateral”), to the extent legally possible and subject to the Intercreditor Agreement, any thin capitalization or tax restrictions, any legal or corporate benefit restrictions and the Agreed Security Principles. All Collateral shall be subject to the operation of the Agreed Security Principles and any Permitted Collateral Liens. See “—Guarantees.” See also “Risk _Factors—Risks Related to the Notes” and “Limitations on Validity and Enforceability of the Guarantees and the Security Interests and Certain Insolvency Law Considerations.”_ On the Issue Date, the notes and the obligations under the Indenture will also be secured by first-priority security interests over the Escrowed Proceeds pursuant to the Escrow Charge (the “Escrow Collateral”). See ‘‘—Escrow of Proceeds; Special _Mandatory Redemption.’’ The Escrowed Proceeds that is deposited in the Escrow Account will not be charged to secure any_ obligations other than the Issuer’s obligations under the notes. Upon the definitive release of the Escrowed Proceeds in accordance with the Escrow Agreement and the Escrow Charge, the first-priority security over such Escrowed Proceeds will be released. Notwithstanding the foregoing, the Collateral and the guarantees may be limited or capped and certain assets will not be pledged in relation to the notes (or the Liens not perfected), in accordance with the Agreed Security Principles, including (without limitation): - if providing such security or guarantee would be prohibited or limited by general legal or statutory limitations, regulatory restrictions, financial assistance, corporate benefit, fraudulent preference, equitable subordination, foreign exchange laws or regulations (or analogous restrictions), transfer pricing, earnings stripping, controlled foreign corporation, thin capitalization, exchange control restrictions and capital maintenance rules, tax restrictions, retention of title claims, employee consultation or approval requirements and similar matters or providing such guarantee or security would not be within the legal capacity of the relevant members of the Group or conflict with the fiduciary or statutory duties of their directors or contravene any applicable legal, regulatory or contractual prohibition or restriction or have the potential to result in a material risk of personal or criminal liability of any director or officer of any member of the Group after the use of reasonable endeavors (but without incurring material cost and without adverse impact on relationships with third parties) to overcome such obstacles; - if the time and cost (including adverse effects on taxes, interest deductibility, stamp duty, registration taxes, registration fees, legal fees, notarial costs or any other fees, costs, commissions or expenses directly associated with the granting of the guarantee or security) of providing the guarantee or security (and in respect of the security, the extent of its perfection and/or registration) is not proportionate to the benefit accruing to the secured parties of obtaining such guarantee or security; ----- - if a class of assets to be secured includes material and immaterial assets and the cost involved in creating security over the immaterial assets is not proportionate to the benefit of such security, only the material assets in that category will be subject to security; - if in certain jurisdictions it may be either impossible or impractical to grant a guarantee or create security over certain categories of assets, the guarantee will not be granted and/or security will not be taken over such assets; - if any assets are subject to legal requirements, contracts, leases, licenses or any other third party arrangements which may prevent those assets from being pledged or subject to the applicable guarantee (including requiring a consent of any third party, minority shareholders, supervisory board or works council (or equivalent)) or where providing such security or guarantees would give a third party the right to terminate or otherwise amend any rights, benefits and/or obligations with respect to any member of the Group in respect of those assets or as a result such guarantees or require any of them to take any action materially adverse to the interests of the Group provided that the relevant member of the Group will use commercially reasonable endeavors to obtain any necessary consent to pledge any such assets or provide such guarantee if the Security Agent (acting in good faith) specifies prior to the date of the security document that a relevant asset or guarantee is material and the Issuer in consultation with the relevant Obligor is satisfied that such endeavors will not involve placing relationships with third parties in jeopardy, or otherwise, will be excluded from any relevant security or guarantee; - any requirement for any member of the Group to use reasonable endeavors (or similar) to comply with or to effect any action, including to grant, perfect or confirm any guarantee or security or to obtain a consent, agreement or permission, shall apply for a period no longer than 60 days (or such shorter period as may be specified) and, if following the expiry of such 60 day (or shorter) period, the relevant member of the Group has been unable to comply or to effect such action, such requirement shall cease to apply; - if providing such security, perfecting such security or granting such guarantee (i) would not be customary under relevant local law or (ii) would have a material adverse effect on the ability of the Issuer or any Subsidiary to conduct its operations and business in the ordinary course as otherwise not prohibited by the Indenture, or materially adversely affects the tax arrangements of the Issuer or such Subsidiary, and any requirement under the Agreed Security Principles to seek consent of any person or take or not take any other action shall be subject to this principle; - if security over such assets or guarantee from such person is required to support acquired indebtedness to the extent such acquired indebtedness is not restricted by the Indenture, or if the terms of the documentation governing such acquired indebtedness prevents the granting of such security or guarantee; - to the extent possible and unless required by applicable law, there should be no action required to be taken in relation to the guarantees or security with respect to any transfers or assignments by the secured parties and no member of the Group (nor any holding company of any member of the Group) shall bear or otherwise be liable for any taxes, any notarial, registration or perfection fees or any other costs, fees or expenses that result from any assignment or transfer by a secured party; - any security document shall only be required to be notarized or notarially certified if required by law in order for the relevant security to become enforceable or admissible in evidence; - no security document shall be governed by the laws of a jurisdiction other than a security jurisdiction, which are France, Germany, Italy, Spain, England & and Wales, The Netherlands and the jurisdiction of incorporation of an entity that has acceded as an additional guarantor (the “Security Jurisdictions”); - (i) all security interests (other than as set forth in subclause (ii) below) over an asset shall be governed by the law of the jurisdiction of incorporation in which that asset is located provided that (i) where the asset comprises a contract, a security interest may be governed by the governing law of that contract and (ii) except where it is inappropriate under applicable laws, share security over any subsidiary will be governed by the law of the jurisdiction of incorporation of that subsidiary; - (i) no security documents governed by, or perfection actions under, the law of a jurisdiction other than a Security Jurisdiction shall be required and (ii) in respect of the same assets, security documents and perfection actions may not be required in more than one Security Jurisdiction; ----- - in the case of security from or guarantees over, or over assets of, any joint venture or similar arrangement, any minority interest or any member of the Group that is not wholly-owned by another member of the Group; - no notices shall be required to be sent to insurers, third party debtors or other contractual third parties prior to a Declared Default that is continuing; - in the case of assets subject to security which is a Permitted Lien; and - no control agreements or perfection by control or similar arrangements will be required with respect to any deposit accounts, securities accounts or other assets. The Collateral (other than the Escrow Charge and the Notes Priority Collateral) will also secure, on a first-priority basis, liabilities under the Credit Agreement, hedging agreements and certain other future Indebtedness. Each Security Document shall contain a clause which records that: (i) if there is a conflict between the Security Document and the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement then (to the extent permitted by law and to the extent it would not prejudice the creation, priority, perfection, validity or enforceability of the Security created under the transaction security documents) the provisions of the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or Additional Intercreditor Agreement, as applicable, shall take priority over the provisions of the Security Document; and (ii) notwithstanding any provision of a Security Document, the terms of the Security Documents shall not operate or be construed so as to prohibit or restrict something which would otherwise be permitted under the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement and any Additional Intercreditor Agreement. Subject to certain conditions, including compliance with the covenant described under “—Certain Covenants—Impairment of _Security Interest,” the Collateral may also secure other Indebtedness, including on a basis senior to, junior to or pari passu with_ the notes, and the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries are permitted to grant security over the Collateral in connection with future issuances of their Indebtedness or Indebtedness of the Issuer and its Restricted Subsidiaries, including any additional notes, in each case, as permitted under the Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement. See “Description of Certain Financing _and Guarantee Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement” and “—Certain Covenants—Liens” below. The enforcement of the_ Security Documents will be subject to the procedures set forth in the Intercreditor Agreement. In general, the rights of the Security Agent (acting on its own behalf or on behalf of the holders of the notes) to take enforcement action under the Security Documents in respect of the Collateral will be subject to certain standstill provisions, payment blockage and other limits on enforcement. The ability to enforce may also be restricted by similar arrangements in relation to future Indebtedness that is secured by the Collateral in compliance with the Indenture and the Intercreditor Agreement. See “Description of Certain _Financing and Guarantee Arrangements—Intercreditor Agreement”. The proceeds from enforcement of the Collateral may not_ be sufficient to satisfy the obligations owed to the holders of the notes. The Collateral or, in relation to clause (6) below, the Escrowed Proceeds, may be released, and the Security Agent and the Trustee shall take any action required to effectuate any release of the Collateral (without the consent of the holders of the notes, and at the request and expense of the Issuer) as required by the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or the Security Documents: # 1. if a Guarantor is released from its Guarantee pursuant to the Indenture, the release of the property and assets of, and Capital Stock of, such Guarantor; # 2. if the Issuer designates any Restricted Subsidiary to be an Unrestricted Subsidiary following release of the property and assets and Capital Stock of such Unrestricted Subsidiary; # 3. in connection with any transaction permitted under the covenant described under “—Merger, Consolidation or Sale _of All or Substantially All Assets” or, other than with respect to the pledge of the shares held in the Issuer, upon a_ disposition not prohibited by the provisions described under “—Certain Covenants—Asset Sales;” # 4. pursuant to an IPO Pushdown permitted by the Indenture; 5. other than with respect to the Notes Priority Collateral, upon the release of the security interest securing such Collateral under the Credit Agreement (other than in connection with discharge of the obligations thereunder) or in accordance with the covenant described under “Certain Covenants—Liens” if the indebtedness that gave rise to the obligation to grant the Lien over such Collateral in favor of the notes is released; ----- # 6. in relation to the Escrow Charge, upon release of the Escrowed Proceeds in accordance with the terms of the Escrow Agreement and the Escrow Charge; # 7. upon the defeasance or discharge of the notes as provided in “—Defeasance” or “—Satisfaction and Discharge,” in each case, in accordance with the terms of the Indenture; # 8. as described under “—Amendment, Supplement and Waiver;” 9. as described under “—Impairment of Security Interest;” 10. as provided for in the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement; # 11. in connection with a Permitted Parent Reorganization; and 12. as otherwise permitted in accordance with the Indenture.

Section Title: DESCRIPTION OF CERTAIN FINANCING AND GUARANTEE ARRANGEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Topco and the Issuer shall not, and shall not permit any Restricted Subsidiary to, take any action that would have the result of materially impairing the security interest with respect to the Collateral or the Escrow Collateral (it being understood that the Incurrence of Permitted Collateral Liens shall under no circumstances be deemed to materially impair the security interest with respect to the Collateral) for the benefit of the Trustee and the holders, and the Issuer and Topco shall not, and shall not permit any Guarantor to, grant to any Person other than the Security Agent, for the benefit of the Trustee and the holders and the other beneficiaries described in the Security Documents and the Escrow Charge, any Lien over any of the Collateral or the Escrow Collateral that is prohibited by the covenant entitled “Certain Covenants—Liens;” provided, that the Issuer and any Guarantor may Incur any Lien over any of the Collateral that is not prohibited by the covenant entitled “Certain Covenants—Liens,” including Permitted Collateral Liens, and the Collateral may be discharged, transferred or released in any circumstances not prohibited by the Indenture, the Intercreditor Agreement or the applicable Security Document. Notwithstanding the foregoing, nothing in this covenant shall restrict the discharge and release of any Lien in accordance with the Indenture, the Escrow Agreement or the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, as applicable, pursuant to the incurrence of Permitted Collateral Liens or any action expressly permitted by the Indenture, the Escrow Agreement, the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement, as applicable. Subject to the foregoing, the Security Documents may be amended, extended, renewed, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified or released (followed by a substantially concurrent retaking of a Lien of at least equivalent ranking over the same assets) to (i) cure any ambiguity, omission, defect or inconsistency therein; (ii) provide for Permitted Collateral Liens; (iii) add to the Collateral; (iv) effect a Permitted Parent Reorganization or (v) make any other change thereto that does not adversely affect the holders in any material respect as determined by the Issuer in good faith and evidenced by an Officer’s Certificate delivered to the Trustee; provided, however, that (except where permitted by the Indenture or the Intercreditor Agreement or any Additional Intercreditor Agreement or to effect or facilitate the creation of Permitted Collateral Liens for the benefit of the Security Agent and holders of other Indebtedness Incurred in accordance with the Indenture), no Security Document may be amended, extended, renewed, restated, supplemented or otherwise modified or released (followed by a substantially concurrent retaking of a lien of at least equivalent ranking over the same assets), unless contemporaneously with such amendment, extension, renewal, restatement, supplement or modification or release (followed by a substantially concurrent retaking of a Lien
